BOOK [I]0-i _ [I]0-i [MISS BRUSS]101-miss bruss , [the perfect secretary]275-the perfect secretary , received [Nona Manford]102-nona at the door of [[[her]102-nona mother]276-her mother 's boudoir]277-her mother 's boudoir ( " [the office]2608-the office , "[103-dexter] [[Mrs. Manford]103-dexter 's children]278-mrs. manford 's children called it ) with a gesture of the kindliest denial . " [She]103-dexter wants to , [you]102-nona know , [dear]2609-dear -- [[your]102-nona mother]2610-your mother always wants to see [you]102-nona , "[104-maisie] pleaded [Maisie Bruss]104-maisie , in a voice which seemed to be thinned and sharpened by continuous telephoning . [Miss Bruss]101-miss bruss , attached to [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter 's service since shortly after [the latter]279-the latter 's second marriage , had known [Nona]102-nona from [her]102-nona childhood , and was privileged , even now that [she]101-miss bruss was " out , "[281-the secretary] to treat [her]102-nona with a certain benevolent familiarity -- benevolence being the note of [the Manford household]280-the manford household . " But look at [her]102-nona list -- just for this morning ! "[281-the secretary] [the secretary]281-the secretary continued , handing over a tall morocco - framed tablet , on which was inscribed , in the colourless secretarial hand : " 7.30 Mental uplift . 7.45 Breakfast . 8 . Psycho - analysis . 8.15 See cook . 8.30 Silent Meditation . 8.45 Facial massage . 9 . Man with Persian miniatures . 9.15 Correspondence . 9.30 Manicure . 9.45 Eurythmic exercises . 10 . Hair waved . 10.15 Sit for bust . 10.30 Receive Mothers ' Day deputation . 11 . Dancing lesson . 11.30 Birth Control committee at Mrs.---- "[281-the secretary] " The manicure is there now , late as usual . That 's what martyrizes [[your]102-nona mother]2610-your mother ; [everybody]2612-everybody 's being so unpunctual . [This New]2613-this new [York]1-york life is killing [her]102-nona . "[281-the secretary] " [I]102-nona 'm not unpunctual , "[102-nona] said [Nona Manford]102-nona , leaning in the doorway . " No ; and a miracle , too ! The way [[you]102-nona girls]2614-you girls keep up [your]102-nona dancing all night . [You]102-nona and [Lita]105-lita -- what times [you]102-nona two do have ! "[102-nona] [Miss Bruss]101-miss bruss was becoming almost maternal . " But just run [your]102-nona eye down that list-- . [You]102-nona see [[your]102-nona mother]2610-your mother did n't _ expect _ to see [you]102-nona before lunch ; now did [she]2610-your mother ? "[102-nona] [Nona]102-nona shook [her]102-nona head . " No ; but [you]102-nona might perhaps squeeze [me]102-nona in . "[102-nona] It was said in a friendly , a reasonable tone ; on both sides the matter was being examined with an evident desire for impartiality and good - will . [Nona]102-nona was used to [[her]102-nona mother]276-her mother 's engagements ; used to being squeezed in between [faith - healers]283-faith - healers , [art - dealers]284-art - dealers , [social service workers and manicures]285-social service workers and manicures . When [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter did see [[her]103-dexter children]286-her children [she]103-dexter was perfect to [them]286-her children ; but in this killing New [York]1-york life , with [its]287-its ever - multiplying duties and responsibilities , if [[her]103-dexter family]288-her family had been allowed to tumble in at all hours and devour [her]103-dexter time , [her]103-dexter nervous system simply could n't have stood it -- and how many duties would have been left undone ! [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter 's motto had always been : " There 's a time for everything . "[103-dexter] But there were moments when this optimistic view failed [her]103-dexter , and [she]103-dexter began to think there was n't . This morning , for instance , as [Miss Bruss]101-miss bruss pointed out , [she]103-dexter had had to tell [the new French sculptor who had been all the rage in [New York]2-new york]289-the new french sculptor who had been all the rage in new york for the last month that [she]103-dexter would n't be able to sit to [him]289-the new french sculptor who had been all the rage in new york for more than fifteen minutes , on account of the Birth Control committee meeting at 11.30 at [Mrs.---- Nona]106-nona seldom assisted at these meetings , [her]106-nona own time being -- through force of habit rather than real inclination -- so fully taken up with exercise , athletics and the ceaseless rush from thrill to thrill which was supposed to be the happy privilege of youth . But [she]106-nona had had glimpses enough of the scene : of [the audience of [bright elderly women , with snowy hair , eurythmic movements , and finely - wrinkled over - massaged faces on which a smile of glassy benevolence]291-bright elderly women , with snowy hair , eurythmic movements , and finely - wrinkled over - massaged faces on which a smile of glassy benevolence sat like [their]291-bright elderly women , with snowy hair , eurythmic movements , and finely - wrinkled over - massaged faces on which a smile of glassy benevolence rimless pince - nez]290-the audience of bright elderly women , with snowy hair , eurythmic movements , and finely - wrinkled over - massaged faces on which a smile of glassy benevolence sat like their rimless pince - nez . [They]290-the audience of bright elderly women , with snowy hair , eurythmic movements , and finely - wrinkled over - massaged faces on which a smile of glassy benevolence sat like their rimless pince - nez were all inexorably earnest , aimlessly kind and fathomlessly pure ; and all rather too well - dressed , except [the " prominent woman "[292-the " prominent woman " of the occasion] of the occasion]292-the " prominent woman " of the occasion , who usually wore dowdy clothes , and had steel - rimmed spectacles and straggling wisps of hair . Whatever the question dealt with , [these ladies]293-these ladies always seemed to be the same , and always advocated with equal zeal Birth Control and unlimited maternity , free love or the return to the traditions of [the American home]294-the american home ; and neither [they]293-these ladies nor [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter seemed aware that there was anything contradictory in these doctrines . All [they]293-these ladies knew was that [they]293-these ladies were determined to force [certain persons]295-certain persons to do things that [those persons]296-those persons preferred not to do . [Nona]106-nona , glancing down the serried list , recalled a saying of [[[her]106-nona mother]276-her mother 's former husband]298-her mother 's former husband , [Arthur Wyant]107-wyant : " [[Your]106-nona mother]2610-your mother and [[her]2610-your mother friends]2617-her friends would like to teach [the whole world]2618-the whole world how to say its prayers and brush its teeth . "[107-wyant] [The girl]299-the girl had laughed , as [she]299-the girl could never help laughing at [Wyant]107-wyant 's sallies ; but in reality [she]299-the girl admired [[her]106-nona mother]276-her mother 's zeal , though [she]299-the girl sometimes wondered if it were not a little too promiscuous . [Nona]106-nona was [the daughter of [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter 's second marriage]301-the daughter of mrs. manford 's second marriage , and [[her]106-nona own father]302-her own father , [Dexter Manford]103-dexter , who had had to make [his]302-her own father way in [the world]303-the world , had taught [her]106-nona to revere activity as a virtue in itself ; [his]302-her own father tone in speaking of [Pauline]108-pauline 's zeal was very different from [Wyant]107-wyant 's . [He]302-her own father had been brought up to think there was a virtue in work _ per se _ , even if it served no more useful purpose than the revolving of a squirrel in a wheel . " Perhaps [[your]106-nona mother]2610-your mother tries to cover too much ground ; but it 's very fine of [her]2610-your mother , [you]106-nona know -- [she]2610-your mother never spares [herself]2610-your mother . "[302-her own father] " Nor [us]2620-us ! "[106-nona] [Nona]106-nona sometimes felt tempted to add ; but [Manford]108-pauline 's admiration was contagious . Yes ; [Nona]106-nona did admire [[her]106-nona mother]276-her mother 's altruistic energy ; but [she]106-nona knew well enough that neither [she]106-nona nor [[[her]106-nona brother]305-her brother 's wife [Lita]105-lita]306-her brother 's wife lita would ever follow such an example -- [she]106-nona no more than [Lita]105-lita . [They]307-they belonged to [another generation]308-another generation : to [the bewildered disenchanted young people who had grown up since the Great War , whose energies were more spasmodic and less definitely directed]309-the bewildered disenchanted young people who had grown up since the great war , whose energies were more spasmodic and less definitely directed , and who , above all , wanted a more personal outlet for [them]307-they . " Bother earthquakes in [Bolivia]3-bolivia ! "[105-lita] [Lita]105-lita had once whispered to [Nona]106-nona , when [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter had convoked [the bright elderly women]310-the bright elderly women to deal with a seismic disaster at [the other end of [the world]303-the world]311-the other end of the world , the repetition of which [these ladies]293-these ladies somehow felt could be avoided if [they]293-these ladies sent out a commission immediately to teach [the Bolivians]109-the bolivians to do something [they]109-the bolivians did n't want to do -- not to _ believe _ in earthquakes , for instance . [The young people]314-the young people certainly felt no corresponding desire to set [the houses of others]315-the houses of others in order . Why should n't [the Bolivians]109-the bolivians have earthquakes if [they]109-the bolivians chose to live in [Bolivia]3-bolivia ? And why must [Pauline Manford]108-pauline lie awake over it in [New York]2-new york , and have to learn a new set of Mahatma exercises to dispel the resulting wrinkles ? " [I]106-nona suppose if [we]2621-we feel like that it 's really because [we]2621-we 're too lazy to care , "[106-nona] [Nona]106-nona reflected , with [her]106-nona incorrigible honesty . [She]106-nona turned from [Miss Bruss]101-miss bruss with a slight shrug . " Oh , well , "[106-nona] [she]106-nona murmured . " [You]106-nona know , [pet]2622-pet , "[106-nona] [Miss Bruss]101-miss bruss volunteered , " things always get worse as the season goes on ; and the last fortnight in February is the worst of all , especially with Easter coming as early as it does this year . [I]101-miss bruss never _ could _ see why [they]2623-they picked out such an awkward date for Easter : perhaps those [Florida]4-florida [hotel people]2624-hotel people did it . Why , [[your]2622-pet poor mother]2625-your poor mother was n't even able to see [[your]2622-pet father]2626-your father this morning before [he]2626-your father went down [town]2627-town , though [she]2625-your poor mother thinks it 's _ all wrong _ to let [him]2626-your father go off to [[his]2626-your father office]2628-his office like that , without finding time for a quiet little chat first ... Just a cheery word to put [him]2626-your father in the right mood for the day ... Oh , by the way , [[my]101-miss bruss dear]2629-my dear , [I]101-miss bruss wonder if [you]2622-pet happen to have heard [him]2626-your father say if [he]2626-your father 's dining at [home]2630-home tonight ? Because [you]2622-pet know [he]2626-your father never _ does _ remember to leave word about [his]2626-your father plans , and if [he]2626-your father has n't , [I]101-miss bruss 'd better telephone to [the office]2608-the office to remind [him]2626-your father that it 's the night of the big dinner for [the Marchesa--]2632-the marchesa-- "[101-miss bruss] " Well , [I]299-the girl do n't think [father]2633-father 's dining at [home]2630-home , "[299-the girl] said [the girl]299-the girl indifferently . " Not -- not -- not ? Oh , [my]101-miss bruss gracious ! "[101-miss bruss] clucked [Miss Bruss]101-miss bruss , dashing across [the room]317-the room to the telephone on [her]101-miss bruss own private desk . The engagement - list had slipped from [her]101-miss bruss hands , and [Nona Manford]102-nona , picking it up , ran [her]102-nona glance over it . [She]102-nona read : " 4 P.M. See A.--4.30 P.M. Musical : Torfried Lobb . "[102-nona] " 4 P.M. See A. "[102-nona] [Nona]102-nona had been almost sure it was [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter 's day for going to see [[her]102-nona divorced husband]318-her divorced husband , [Arthur Wyant]107-wyant , [the effaced mysterious person always designated on [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter 's lists as " A , "[319-the effaced mysterious person always designated on mrs. manford 's lists as " a , " and hence known to her children] and hence known to [[her]103-dexter children]286-her children]319-the effaced mysterious person always designated on mrs. manford 's lists as " a , " and hence known to her children as " Exhibit A. "[319-the effaced mysterious person always designated on mrs. manford 's lists as " a , " and hence known to her children] It was rather a bore , for [Nona]102-nona had meant to go and see [him]107-wyant [herself]102-nona at about that hour , and [she]102-nona always timed [her]102-nona visits so that they should not clash with [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter 's , not because [the latter]279-the latter disapproved of [Nona]102-nona 's friendship with [Arthur Wyant]107-wyant ( [she]102-nona thought it " beautiful "[102-nona] of [the girl]299-the girl to show [him]107-wyant so much kindness ) , but because [Wyant]107-wyant and [Nona]102-nona were agreed that on these occasions the presence of [the former Mrs. Wyant]110-jim spoilt [their]323-their fun . But there was nothing to do about it . [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter 's plans were unchangeable . Even illness and death barely caused a ripple in [them]324-them . [One]325-one might as well have tried to bring down one of the Pyramids by poking it with a parasol as attempt to disarrange the close mosaic of [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter 's engagement - list . [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter [herself]103-dexter could n't have done it ; not with the best will in [the world]303-the world ; and [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter 's will , as [[her]103-dexter children]286-her children and [all [her]103-dexter household]328-all her household knew , was the best in [the world]303-the world . [Nona Manford]102-nona moved away with a final shrug . [She]102-nona had wanted to speak to [[her]102-nona mother]276-her mother about something rather important ; something [she]102-nona had caught a startled glimpse of , the evening before , in the queer little half - formed mind of [[her]102-nona sister - in - law]331-her sister - in - law [Lita]105-lita , [the wife of [[her]102-nona half - brother]333-her half - brother [Jim Wyant]110-jim -- the Lita with whom , as [Miss Bruss]101-miss bruss remarked , [she]102-nona , [Nona]102-nona , danced away the nights . There was [nobody on earth]334-nobody on earth as dear to [Nona]102-nona as that same [Jim]110-jim , [[her]102-nona elder]335-her elder by six or seven years , and who had been [brother]336-brother , [comrade , guardian]337-comrade , guardian , almost father to [her]102-nona -- [[her]102-nona own father]302-her own father , [Dexter Manford]103-dexter , who was so clever , capable and kind , being almost always too busy at [the office]2608-the office , or too firmly requisitioned by [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter , when [he]302-her own father was at [home]2630-home , to be able to spare much time for [[his]302-her own father daughter]341-his daughter]332-the wife of her half - brother jim wyant -- the lita with whom , as miss bruss remarked , she , nona , danced away the nights . there was nobody on earth as dear to nona as that same jim , her elder by six or seven years , and who had been brother , comrade , guardian , almost father to her -- her own father , dexter manford , who was so clever , capable and kind , being almost always too busy at the office , or too firmly requisitioned by mrs. manford , when he was at home , to be able to spare much time for his daughter . [Jim]110-jim , bless [him]110-jim , always had time ; no doubt that was what [[his]110-jim mother]342-his mother meant when [she]342-his mother called [him]110-jim lazy -- as lazy as [[his]110-jim father]343-his father , [she]342-his mother had once added , with one of [her]342-his mother rare flashes of impatience . Nothing so conduced to impatience in [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter as the thought of [anybody]344-anybody 's having the least fraction of unapportioned time and not immediately planning to do something with it . If only [they]345-they could have given it to _ [her]103-dexter _ ! And [Jim]110-jim , who loved and admired [her]103-dexter ( as all [[her]103-dexter family]288-her family did ) was always conscientiously trying to fill [his]110-jim days , or to conceal from [her]103-dexter [their]345-they occasional vacuity . But [he]110-jim had a way of not being in a hurry , and this had been all to the good for [little Nona]102-nona , who could always count on [him]110-jim to ride or walk with [her]102-nona , to slip off with [her]102-nona to a concert or a " movie , "[110-jim] or , more pleasantly still , just to _ be there_--idling in [the big untenanted library of [Cedarledge]5-cedarledge]347-the big untenanted library of cedarledge , [the place in [the country]349-the country]348-the place in the country , or in [[his]110-jim untidy study]350-his untidy study on [the third floor of [the town house]352-the town house]351-the third floor of the town house , and ready to answer questions , help [her]102-nona to look up hard words in dictionaries , mend [her]102-nona golf - sticks , or get a thorn out of [her]102-nona Sealyham 's paw . [Jim]110-jim was wonderful with [his]110-jim hands : [he]110-jim could repair clocks , start up mechanical toys , make fascinating models of [houses]353-houses or [gardens]354-gardens , apply a tourniquet , scramble eggs , mimic [[[his]110-jim mother]342-his mother 's visitors]356-his mother 's visitors -- preferably [the " earnest "[2635-the " earnest " ones who held forth about " causes " or " messages "] ones who held forth about " causes "[342-his mother] or " messages "]2635-the " earnest " ones who held forth about " causes " or " messages "[342-his mother] in [[her]342-his mother gilded drawing - rooms]357-her gilded drawing - rooms -- and make delicious coloured maps of [imaginary continents]358-imaginary continents , concerning which [Nona]102-nona wrote interminable stories . And of all these gifts [he]110-jim had , alas , made no particular use as yet -- except to enchant [[his]110-jim little half - sister]359-his little half - sister . It had been just the same , [Nona]102-nona knew , with [[his]110-jim father]343-his father : poor useless " Exhibit A "[102-nona] ! [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter said it was [their]361-their " old [New York]2-new york blood"--she[103-dexter] spoke of [them]361-their with mingled contempt and pride , as if [they]361-their were the last of [the Capetians , exhausted by a thousand years of sovereignty]362-the capetians , exhausted by a thousand years of sovereignty . [Her]102-nona own red corpuscles were tinged with a more plebeian dye . [[Her]102-nona progenitors]363-her progenitors had mined in [Pennsylvania]6-pennsylvania and made bicycles at [Exploit]7-exploit , and now gave [their]363-her progenitors name to [one of the most popular automobiles in [the United States]365-the united states]364-one of the most popular automobiles in the united states . Not that other ingredients were lacking in [her]102-nona hereditary make - up : [[her]102-nona mother]276-her mother was said to have contributed southern gentility by being [a Pascal of [Tallahassee]8-tallahassee]367-a pascal of tallahassee . [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter , in certain moods , spoke of " [The Pascals of [Tallahassee]8-tallahassee]2636-the pascals of tallahassee "[368-they] as if [they]368-they accounted for all that was noblest in [her]102-nona ; but when [she]103-dexter was exhorting [Jim]110-jim to action it was [[her]102-nona father]369-her father 's blood that [she]103-dexter invoked . " After all , in spite of the Pascal tradition , there is no shame in being in trade . [[My]103-dexter father 's father]2637-my father 's father came over from [Scotland]9-scotland with two sixpences in [his]2637-my father 's father pocket ... "[103-dexter] and [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter would glance with pardonable pride at the glorious Gainsborough over the dining - room mantelpiece ( which [she]103-dexter sometimes almost mistook for an ancestral portrait ) , and at [[her]103-dexter healthy handsome family]370-her healthy handsome family sitting about the dinner - table laden with Georgian silver and orchids from [[her]103-dexter own hot - houses]371-her own hot - houses . From the threshold , [Nona]102-nona called back to [Miss Bruss]101-miss bruss : " Please tell [mother]2638-mother [I]102-nona shall probably be lunching with [Jim]110-jim and [Lita--]111-lita-- "[102-nona] but [Miss Bruss]101-miss bruss was passionately saying to [an unseen interlocutor]372-an unseen interlocutor : " Oh , but [Mr. Rigley]112-mr. rigley , but [you]112-mr. rigley _ must _ make [Mr. Manford]113-mr. manford understand that [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter counts on [him]333-her half - brother for dinner this evening ... "[101-miss bruss] The marriage of [[her]103-dexter half - brother]333-her half - brother had been [Nona Manford]102-nona 's first real sorrow . Not that [she]102-nona had disapproved of [his]333-her half - brother choice : how could [any one]374-any one take that funny irresponsible little [Lita Cliffe]105-lita seriously enough to disapprove of [her]105-lita ? [The sisters - in - law]375-the sisters - in - law were soon [the best of friends]376-the best of friends ; if [Nona]102-nona had a fault to find with [Lita]105-lita , it was that [she]102-nona did n't worship the incomparable [Jim]110-jim as blindly as [[his]333-her half - brother sister]377-his sister did . But then [Lita]105-lita was made to be worshipped , not to worship ; that was manifest in the calm gaze of [her]105-lita long narrow nut - coloured eyes , in the hieratic fixity of [her]105-lita lovely smile , in the very shape of [her]105-lita hands , so slim yet dimpled , hands which had never grown up , and which drooped from [her]105-lita wrists as if listlessly waiting to be kissed , or lay like rare shells or upcurved magnolia - petals on the cushions luxuriously piled about [her]105-lita indolent body . [The Jim Wyants]116-jim had been married for nearly two years now ; [the baby]378-the baby was six months old ; [the pair]379-the pair were beginning to be regarded as [one of [the " old couples "[381-the " old couples " of their set] of [their]379-the pair set]381-the " old couples " of their set , one of the settled landmarks in [the matrimonial quicksands of [New York]2-new york]382-the matrimonial quicksands of new york]380-one of the " old couples " of their set , one of the settled landmarks in the matrimonial quicksands of new york . [Nona]102-nona 's love for [[her]102-nona brother]305-her brother was too disinterested for [her]102-nona not to rejoice in this : above all things [she]102-nona wanted [her]102-nona old [Jim]116-jim to be happy , and happy [she]102-nona was sure [he]116-jim was -- or had been until lately . The mere getting away from [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter 's iron rule had been a greater relief than [he]116-jim [himself]116-jim perhaps guessed . And then [he]116-jim was still [the foremost of [[Lita]105-lita 's worshippers]385-lita 's worshippers]384-the foremost of lita 's worshippers ; still enchanted by the childish whims , the unpunctuality , the irresponsibility , which made life with [her]105-lita such a thrillingly unsettled business after the clock - work routine of [[[his]116-jim mother]342-his mother 's perfect establishment]387-his mother 's perfect establishment . All this [Nona]102-nona rejoiced in ; but [she]102-nona ached at times with the loneliness of [the perfect establishment]388-the perfect establishment , now that [Jim]116-jim , [its]388-the perfect establishment one disturbing element , had left . [Jim]116-jim guessed [her]102-nona loneliness , [she]102-nona was sure : it was [he]116-jim who encouraged the growing intimacy between [[his]116-jim wife]389-his wife and [[his]116-jim half - sister]390-his half - sister , and tried to make [the latter]279-the latter feel that [[his]116-jim house]392-his house was [another home to [her]102-nona]393-another home to her . [Lita]105-lita had always been amiably disposed toward [Nona]102-nona . [The two]394-the two , though so fundamentally different , were nearly of an age , and united by the prevailing passion for every form of sport . [Lita]105-lita , in spite of [her]105-lita soft curled - up attitudes , was not only [a tireless dancer]395-a tireless dancer but [a brilliant if uncertain tennis - player]396-a brilliant if uncertain tennis - player , and [an adventurous rider to hounds]397-an adventurous rider to hounds . Between [her]105-lita hours of lolling , and smoking amber - scented cigarettes , every moment of [her]105-lita life was crammed with dancing , riding or games . During the two or three months before [the baby]378-the baby 's birth , when [Lita]105-lita had been reduced to partial inactivity , [Nona]102-nona had rather feared that [her]102-nona perpetual craving for new " thrills "[102-nona] might lead to some insidious form of time - killing -- some of the drinking or drugging that went on among [the young women of [their]399-the young women of their set set]399-the young women of their set ; but [Lita]105-lita had sunk into a state of smiling animal patience , as if the mysterious work going on in [her]105-lita tender young body had a sacred significance for [her]105-lita , and it was enough to lie still and let it happen . All [she]105-lita asked was that nothing should " hurt "[105-lita] [her]105-lita : [she]105-lita had the blind dread of physical pain common also to [most of [the young women of [her]105-lita set]401-the young women of her set]400-most of the young women of her set . But all that was so easily managed nowadays : [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter ( who took charge of the business , [Lita]105-lita being [an orphan]402-an orphan ) of course knew [the most perfect " Twilight Sleep "[103-dexter] establishment in [the country]349-the country]403-the most perfect " twilight sleep " establishment in the country , installed [Lita]105-lita in [[its]403-the most perfect " twilight sleep " establishment in the country most luxurious suite]405-its most luxurious suite , and filled [[her]105-lita rooms]406-her rooms with spring flowers , hot - house fruits , new novels and all the latest picture - papers -- and [Lita]105-lita drifted into motherhood as lightly and unperceivingly as if the wax doll which suddenly appeared in the cradle at [her]105-lita bedside had been brought there in one of the big bunches of hot - house roses that [she]105-lita found every morning on [her]105-lita pillow . " Of course there ought to be no Pain ... nothing but Beauty ... It ought to be one of the loveliest , most poetic things in [the world]303-the world to have [a baby]2640-a baby , "[103-dexter] [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter declared , in that bright efficient voice which made loveliness and poetry sound like the attributes of an advanced industrialism , and [babies]407-babies something to be turned out in series like [Fords]10-fords . And [Jim]116-jim 's joy in [[his]116-jim son]408-his son had been unbounded ; and [Lita]105-lita really had n't minded in the least . II [THE Marchesa]114-the marchesa was something which happened at irregular but inevitable moments in [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter 's life . [Most people]409-most people would have regarded [the Marchesa]114-the marchesa as a disturbance ; some as a distinct inconvenience ; the pessimistic as a misfortune . It was a matter of conscious pride to [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter that , while recognizing these elements in the case , [she]103-dexter had always contrived to make out of it something not only showy but even enviable . For , after all , if [[your]410-your husband]411-your husband ( even [an ex - husband]412-an ex - husband ) has [a first cousin called [Amalasuntha degli Duchi di Lucera]117-amalasuntha , who has married [the Marchese Venturino di San Fedele]118-venturino , of [one of [the great Neapolitan families]415-the great neapolitan families]414-one of the great neapolitan families]413-a first cousin called amalasuntha degli duchi di lucera , who has married the marchese venturino di san fedele , of one of the great neapolitan families , it seems stupid and wasteful not to make some use of such a conjunction of names and situations , and to remember only ( as [the Wyants]116-jim did ) that when [Amalasuntha]117-amalasuntha came to [New York]2-new york it was always to get money , or to get [[her]117-amalasuntha dreadful son]416-her dreadful son out of a new scrape , or to consult [the family lawyers]417-the family lawyers as to some new way of guarding the remains of [her]117-amalasuntha fortune against [Venturino]118-venturino 's systematic depredations . [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter knew in advance the hopelessness of these quests -- all of them , that is , except that which consisted in borrowing money from [herself]103-dexter . [She]103-dexter always lent [Amalasuntha]117-amalasuntha two or three thousand dollars ( and put it down to the profit - and - loss column of [her]103-dexter carefully - kept private accounts ) ; [she]103-dexter even gave [the Marchesa]114-the marchesa [her]114-the marchesa own last year 's clothes , cleverly retouched ; and in return [she]103-dexter expected [Amalasuntha]117-amalasuntha to shed on the [Manford]103-dexter entertainments that exotic lustre which [the near relative of a Duke who is also [a grandee of [Spain]11-spain]419-a grandee of spain and [a great dignitary of the Papal Court]420-a great dignitary of the papal court trails with [her]114-the marchesa through the dustiest by - ways , even if [[her]114-the marchesa mother]276-her mother has been [a mere Mary Wyant of [Albany]12-albany]422-a mere mary wyant of albany]418-the near relative of a duke who is also a grandee of spain and a great dignitary of the papal court trails with her through the dustiest by - ways , even if her mother has been a mere mary wyant of albany . [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter had been successful . [The Marchesa]114-the marchesa , without taking thought , fell naturally into the part assigned to [her]114-the marchesa . In [her]114-the marchesa stormy and uncertain life , [New York]2-new york , where [[her]114-the marchesa rich relations]423-her rich relations lived , and from which [she]114-the marchesa always came back with a few thousand dollars , and clothes that could be made to last a year , and good advice about putting the screws on [Venturino]118-venturino , was like a foretaste of heaven . " Live [there]2641-there ? [Carina]119-carina , _ no _ ! It is too -- too uneventful . As [heaven]2642-heaven must be . But [everybody]2612-everybody is celestially kind ... and [Venturino]118-venturino has learnt that there are certain things [[my]117-amalasuntha American relations]2644-my american relations will not tolerate ... "[117-amalasuntha] Such was [Amalasuntha]117-amalasuntha 's version of [her]117-amalasuntha visits to [New York]2-new york , when [she]117-amalasuntha recounted them in [the drawing - rooms of [Rome]13-rome]424-the drawing - rooms of rome , [Naples]14-naples or [St. Moritz]15-st. moritz ; whereas in [New York]2-new york , quite carelessly and unthinkingly -- for [no one]425-no one was simpler at heart than [Amalasuntha]117-amalasuntha -- [she]117-amalasuntha pronounced names , and raised suggestions , which cast a romantic glow of unreality over [a world bounded by [Wall Street]16-wall street on the south and [Long Island]17-long island]426-a world bounded by wall street on the south and long island in most other directions ; and in this glow [Pauline Manford]108-pauline was always eager to sun [[her]108-pauline other guests]427-her other guests . " [[[My]117-amalasuntha husband]2645-my husband 's cousin]2646-my husband 's cousin "[117-amalasuntha] ( become , since the divorce from [Wyant]110-jim " [[my]117-amalasuntha son]2647-my son 's cousin "[117-amalasuntha] ) was still , after twenty - seven years , a useful social card . [The Marchesa di San Fedele]428-the marchesa di san fedele , now [a woman of fifty]429-a woman of fifty , was still , in [Pauline]108-pauline 's set , a pretext for dinners , a means of paying off social scores , a small but steady luminary in [the uncertain [New York]2-new york heavens]430-the uncertain new york heavens . [Pauline]108-pauline could never see [her]117-amalasuntha rather forlorn wisp of a figure , always clothed in careless unnoticeable black ( even when [she]117-amalasuntha wore [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter 's old dresses ) , without a vision of echoing Roman staircases , of the torchlit arrival of Cardinals at [the Lucera receptions]431-the lucera receptions , of a great fresco - like background of [Popes]432-popes , [princes]433-princes , [dilapidated palaces]434-dilapidated palaces , [cypress - guarded villas]435-cypress - guarded villas , scandals , tragedies , and interminable feuds about inheritances . " It 's all so dreadful -- the wicked lives [those great Roman families]2648-those great roman families lead . After all , poor [Amalasuntha]117-amalasuntha has good American blood in [her]117-amalasuntha -- [[her]117-amalasuntha mother]276-her mother was [a Wyant]2650-a wyant ; yes -- [Mary Wyant]120-mary wyant married [Prince Ottaviano di Lago Negro]121-prince ottaviano di lago negro , [the Duke of [[Lucera]18-lucera 's son]2652-lucera 's son , who used to be at [the Italian Legation in [Washington]19-washington]2653-the italian legation in washington]2651-the duke of lucera 's son , who used to be at the italian legation in washington ; but what is [Amalasuntha]117-amalasuntha to do , in [a country where there 's no divorce]2654-a country where there 's no divorce , and [a woman]2655-a woman just has to put up with _ everything _ ? [The Pope]2656-the pope has been most kind ; [he]2656-the pope sides entirely with [Amalasuntha]117-amalasuntha . But [[Venturino]118-venturino 's people]2657-venturino 's people are very powerful too -- [a great Neapolitan family]2658-a great neapolitan family -- yes , [Cardinal Ravello]122-cardinal ravello is [[Venturino]118-venturino 's uncle]2659-venturino 's uncle ... so that altogether it 's been dreadful for [Amalasuntha]117-amalasuntha ... and such an oasis to [her]117-amalasuntha , coming back to [[her]117-amalasuntha own people]2660-her own people ... "[108-pauline] [Pauline Manford]108-pauline was quite sincere in believing that it was dreadful for [Amalasuntha]117-amalasuntha . [Pauline]108-pauline [herself]108-pauline could conceive of nothing more shocking than [a social organization which did not recognize divorce]436-a social organization which did not recognize divorce , and let all kinds of domestic evils fester undisturbed , instead of having [people]437-people 's lives disinfected and whitewashed at regular intervals , like [the cellar]438-the cellar . But while [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter thought all this -- in fact , in the very act of thinking it -- [she]108-pauline remembered that [Cardinal Ravello]122-cardinal ravello , [[Venturino]118-venturino 's uncle]2659-venturino 's uncle , had been mentioned as [one of the probable delegates to the Roman Catholic Congress which was to meet at [Baltimore]20-baltimore]440-one of the probable delegates to the roman catholic congress which was to meet at baltimore that winter , and wondered whether an evening party for [his]122-cardinal ravello Eminence could not be organized with [Amalasuntha]117-amalasuntha 's help ; even got as far as considering the effect of torch - bearing footmen ( in silk stockings ) lining the [Manford]103-dexter staircase -- which was of marble , thank goodness!--and of [Dexter Manford]103-dexter and [Jim]110-jim receiving [the Prince of [the Church]442-the church]441-the prince of the church on the doorstep , and walking [upstairs]443-upstairs backward carrying silver candelabra ; though [Pauline]108-pauline was n't sure [she]108-pauline could persuade [them]444-them to go as far as that . [Pauline]108-pauline felt no more inconsistency in this double train of thought than [she]108-pauline did in shuddering at the crimes of [the Roman Church]445-the roman church and longing to receive one of [[its]445-the roman church dignitaries]446-its dignitaries with all the proper ceremonial . [She]108-pauline was used to such rapid adjustments , and proud of the fact that whole categories of contradictory opinions lay down together in [her]108-pauline mind as peacefully as the Happy Families exhibited by [strolling circuses]447-strolling circuses . And of course , if [the Cardinal _]448-the cardinal _ did _ come to [[her]108-pauline house]449-her house , [she]108-pauline would show [her]108-pauline American independence by inviting also [the Bishop of [New York]2-new york]450-the bishop of new york -- [[her]108-pauline own Episcopal Bishop]451-her own episcopal bishop -- and possibly [the Chief Rabbi]452-the chief rabbi ( also [a friend of hers]453-a friend of hers ) , and certainly [that wonderful much - slandered " [Mahatma]123-the mahatma "[123-the mahatma] in whom [she]108-pauline still so thoroughly believed ... But the word pulled [her]108-pauline]123-the mahatma up short . Yes ; certainly [she]108-pauline believed in [the " Mahatma]123-the mahatma . "[108-pauline] [She]108-pauline had every reason to . Standing before the tall threefold mirror in [[her]108-pauline dressing - room]454-her dressing - room , [she]108-pauline glanced into [the huge bathroom beyond -- which looked like [a biological laboratory]455-a biological laboratory , with [its]455-a biological laboratory white tiles , polished pipes , weighing machines , mysterious appliances for [douches , gymnastics and " physical culture"--and]2662-douches , gymnastics and " physical culture"--and]2661-the huge bathroom beyond -- which looked like a biological laboratory , with its white tiles , polished pipes , weighing machines , mysterious appliances for douches , gymnastics and " physical culture"--and[108-pauline] recalled with gratitude that it was certainly those eurythmic exercises of the [Mahatma]123-the mahatma 's ( " holy ecstasy , "[456-his] [he]456-his called them ) which had reduced [her]108-pauline hips after everything else had failed . And this gratitude for the reduction of [her]108-pauline hips was exactly on the same plane , in [her]108-pauline neat card - catalogued mind , with [her]108-pauline enthusiastic faith in [his]456-his wonderful mystical teachings about Self - Annihilation , Anterior Existence and Astral Affinities ... all so incomprehensible and so pure ... Yes ; [she]108-pauline would certainly ask [the Mahatma]123-the mahatma . It would do [the Cardinal]457-the cardinal good to have a talk with [him]456-his . [She]108-pauline could almost hear [[his]456-his Eminence]458-his eminence saying , in a voice shaken by emotion : " [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter , [I]458-his eminence want to thank [you]103-dexter for making [me]458-his eminence know that [Wonderful Man]124-wonderful man . If it had n't been for [you--]103-dexter "[458-his eminence] Ah , [she]108-pauline did like [people]437-people who said to [her]108-pauline : " If it had n't been for [you--]108-pauline ! "[437-people] The telephone on [her]108-pauline dressing - table rang . [Miss Bruss]101-miss bruss had switched on from the boudoir . [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter , as [she]103-dexter unhooked the receiver , cast a nervous glance at the clock . [She]103-dexter was already seven minutes late for [her]103-dexter Marcel - waving , and-- Ah : it was [Dexter]103-dexter 's voice ! Automatically [she]103-dexter composed [her]103-dexter face to a wifely smile , and [her]103-dexter voice to a corresponding intonation . " Yes ? [Pauline]108-pauline , [dear]2609-dear . "[103-dexter] ( The smile grew a little pinched ; the voice echoed it . Then , patiently ): " Yes ; what else ? ... _ Oh _ ... oh , [Dexter]103-dexter ... what do [you]103-dexter mean ? ... [The Mahatma]123-the mahatma ? _ What _ ? [I]460-she do n't understand ! "[460-she] But [she]460-she did . [She]460-she was conscious of turning white under [her]460-she discreet cosmetics . Somewhere in the depths of [her]460-she there had lurked for the last weeks an unexpressed fear of this very thing : a fear that [the people who were opposed to the teaching of [the Hindu sage]462-the hindu sage]461-the people who were opposed to the teaching of the hindu sage -- [New York]2-new york 's great " spiritual uplift "[103-dexter] of the last two years -- were gaining power and beginning to be a menace . And here was [Dexter Manford]103-dexter actually saying something about having been asked to conduct an investigation into the state of things at [the Mahatma 's " School of Oriental Thought]21-the mahatma 's " school of oriental thought , "[103-dexter] in which all sorts of unpleasantness might be involved . Of course [Dexter]103-dexter never said much about professional matters on the telephone ; [he]463-he did not , to [[his]463-he wife]389-his wife 's thinking , say enough about [them]465-them when [he]463-he got [home]2630-home . But what little [she]460-she now gathered made [her]460-she feel positively ill . " Oh , [Dexter]103-dexter , but [I]460-she must see [you]103-dexter about this ! At once ! [Poor Arthur]126-arthur -- from the first [he]107-wyant had been one of [her]460-she failures . To [the inexperienced Pauline of thirty years ago]471-the inexperienced pauline of thirty years ago , fresh from the factory - smoke of [Exploit]7-exploit , [Arthur Wyant]107-wyant had symbolized the tempting contrast between [a city absorbed in making money]472-a city absorbed in making money and [a society bent on enjoying]473-a society bent on enjoying [it]474-it . [She]460-she did n't know exactly what [she]460-she had expected , [her]460-she own ideal of manly achievement being at that time solely based on the power of getting rich faster than [[your]470-you neighbours]476-your neighbours -- which [Arthur]107-wyant would certainly never do . [[His]107-wyant father - in - law at [Exploit]7-exploit]477-his father - in - law at exploit had seen at a glance that it was no use taking [him]107-wyant into the motor - business , and had remarked philosophically to [Pauline]108-pauline : " Better just regard [him]107-wyant as a piece of jewellery : [I]477-his father - in - law at exploit guess [we]2668-we can afford it . "[477-his father - in - law at exploit] But jewellery must at least be brilliant ; and [Arthur]107-wyant had somehow -- faded . At one time [she]108-pauline had hoped [he]107-wyant might play a part in state politics -- with [Washington]19-washington and [its]19-washington enticing diplomatic society at the end of the vista -- but [he]107-wyant shrugged that away as contemptuously as what [he]107-wyant called " trade . "[107-wyant] At [Cedarledge]5-cedarledge [he]107-wyant farmed a little , fussed over the accounts , and muddled away [her]108-pauline money till [she]108-pauline replaced [him]107-wyant by [a trained superintendent]478-a trained superintendent ; and in [town]2627-town [he]107-wyant spent hours playing bridge at [[his]107-wyant club]480-his club , took an intermittent interest in racing , and went and sat every afternoon with [[his]107-wyant mother]342-his mother , [old Mrs. Wyant]110-jim , in [the dreary house near [Stuyvesant Square]22-stuyvesant square which had never been " done over , "[108-pauline] and was still lit by Carcel lamps]482-the dreary house near stuyvesant square which had never been " done over , " and was still lit by carcel lamps . An obstacle and a disappointment ; that was what [he]107-wyant had always been . Still , [she]108-pauline would have borne with [his]107-wyant inadequacy , [his]107-wyant resultless planning , dreaming and dawdling , even [his]107-wyant growing tendency to drink , as [the wives of [[her]108-pauline generation]484-her generation]483-the wives of her generation were taught to bear with such failings , had it not been for the discovery that [he]107-wyant was also " immoral . "[107-wyant] Immorality [no high - minded woman]485-no high - minded woman could condone ; and when , on [her]108-pauline return from a rest - cure in [California]23-california , [she]108-pauline found that [he]107-wyant had drifted into a furtive love affair with [the dependent cousin who lived with [[his]107-wyant mother]342-his mother]486-the dependent cousin who lived with his mother , every law of self - respect known to [Pauline]108-pauline decreed [his]107-wyant repudiation . [Old Mrs. Wyant]127-old mrs. wyant , horror - struck , banished [the cousin]488-the cousin and pleaded for [[her]108-pauline son]489-her son : [Pauline]108-pauline was adamant . [She]108-pauline addressed [herself]108-pauline to [the rising divorce - lawyer]490-the rising divorce - lawyer , [Dexter Manford]103-dexter , and in [his]490-the rising divorce - lawyer capable hands the affair was settled rapidly , discreetly , without scandal , wrangling or recrimination . [Wyant]127-old mrs. wyant withdrew to [[[his]127-old mrs. wyant mother]342-his mother 's house]492-his mother 's house , and [Pauline]108-pauline went to [Europe]24-europe , [a free woman]493-a free woman . In the early days of the new century divorce had not become a social institution in [New York]2-new york , and the blow to [Wyant]127-old mrs. wyant 's pride was deeper than [Pauline]108-pauline had foreseen . [He]127-old mrs. wyant lived in complete retirement at [[his]127-old mrs. wyant mother]342-his mother 's , saw [[his]127-old mrs. wyant boy]495-his boy at the dates prescribed by [the court]496-the court , and sank into a sort of premature old age which contrasted painfully -- even to [Pauline]108-pauline [herself]108-pauline -- with [her]108-pauline own recovered youth and elasticity . The contrast caused [her]108-pauline a retrospective pang , and gradually , after [her]108-pauline second marriage , and [old Mrs. Wyant]127-old mrs. wyant 's death , [she]108-pauline came to regard [poor Arthur]107-wyant not as a grievance but as a responsibility . [She]108-pauline prided [herself]108-pauline on never neglecting [her]108-pauline responsibilities , and therefore felt a not unnatural vexation with [Arthur]107-wyant for having figured among [her]108-pauline engagements that day , and thus obliged [her]108-pauline to postpone [him]107-wyant . Moving back to the dressing - table [she]108-pauline caught [her]108-pauline reflection in the tall triple glass . Again those fine wrinkles about lids and lips , those vertical lines between the eyes ! [She]108-pauline would not permit it ; no , not for a moment . [She]108-pauline commanded [herself]108-pauline : " Now , [Pauline]108-pauline , _ stop worrying _ . [You]108-pauline know perfectly well there 's no such thing as worry ; it 's only dyspepsia or want of exercise , and everything 's really all right-- "[108-pauline] in the insincere tone of [a mother]497-a mother soothing [a bruised baby]498-a bruised baby . [She]108-pauline looked again , and fancied the wrinkles were really fainter , the vertical lines less deep . Once more [she]108-pauline saw before [her]108-pauline [an erect athletic woman , with all [her]499-an erect athletic woman , with all her hair and all her teeth hair and all [her]499-an erect athletic woman , with all her hair and all her teeth teeth]499-an erect athletic woman , with all her hair and all her teeth , and just a hint of rouge ( because " [people]437-people did it "[499-an erect athletic woman , with all her hair and all her teeth] ) brightening a still fresh complexion ; saw [her]499-an erect athletic woman , with all her hair and all her teeth small symmetrical features , the black brows drawn with a light stroke over handsome directly - gazing gray eyes , the abundant whitening hair which still responded so crisply to the waver 's wand , the firmly planted feet with arched insteps rising to slim ankles . How absurd , how unlike [herself]108-pauline , to be upset by that foolish news ! [She]108-pauline would look in on [Dexter]103-dexter and settle the [Mahatma]123-the mahatma business in five minutes . III AT a quarter past one , when [Nona]102-nona arrived at [[[her]102-nona half - brother]333-her half - brother 's house]504-her half - brother 's house , [she]102-nona was told that [Mrs. Wyant]110-jim was not yet down . [Pauline Manford]108-pauline had been very generous at the time of [[her]108-pauline son]489-her son 's marriage . "[529-the head of the house] [Nona]102-nona looked about [the drawing - room]531-the drawing - room and wondered -- the habit was growing on [her]102-nona . [The drawing - room]531-the drawing - room ( it suddenly occurred to [her]102-nona ) was very expressive of the modern marriage state . [It]531-the drawing - room looked , for all its studied effects , its rather nervous attention to " values , "[531-the drawing - room] complementary colours , and the things [the modern decorator]533-the modern decorator lies awake over , more like [the waiting - room of [a glorified railway station]535-a glorified railway station]534-the waiting - room of a glorified railway station than the setting of an established way of life . Nothing in [it]531-the drawing - room seemed at [home]2630-home or at ease -- from the early kakemono of [a bearded sage]537-a bearded sage , on walls of pale buff silk , to the three mourning irises isolated in a white Sung vase in the desert of an otherwise empty table . The only life in [the room]317-the room was contributed by the agitations of the exotic goldfish in [a huge spherical aquarium]539-a huge spherical aquarium ; and they too were but transients , since [Lita]105-lita insisted on having [the aquarium]540-the aquarium illuminated night and day with electric bulbs , and the sleepless fish were always dying off and having to be replaced . [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter had paid for [the house]530-the house and [its]530-the house decoration . It was not what [she]103-dexter would have wished for [herself]103-dexter -- [she]103-dexter had not yet quite caught up with the new bareness and selectiveness . But neither would [she]103-dexter have wished [the young couple]542-the young couple to live in the opulent setting of tapestries and " period "[103-dexter] furniture which [she]103-dexter [herself]103-dexter preferred . Above all [she]103-dexter wanted [them]542-the young couple to keep up ; to do what [the other young couples]543-the other young couples were doing ; [she]103-dexter had even digested -- in one huge terrified gulp -- [Lita]105-lita 's black boudoir , with [its]530-the house welter of ebony velvet cushions overlooked by a statue as to which [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter could only minimize the indecency by saying that [she]103-dexter understood it was [Cubist]130-cubist . But [she]103-dexter did think it unkind -- after all [she]103-dexter had done -- to have [Nona]102-nona suggest that [Lita]105-lita might get tired of [Jim]110-jim ! The idea had never really troubled [Nona]102-nona -- at least not till lately . Even now [she]102-nona had nothing definite in [her]102-nona mind . Nothing beyond the vague question : what would [a woman like [Lita]105-lita]544-a woman like lita be likely to do if [she]544-a woman like lita suddenly grew tired of the life [she]544-a woman like lita was leading ? But that question kept coming back so often that [she]102-nona had really wanted , that morning , to consult [[her]102-nona mother]276-her mother about it ; for who else was there to consult ? [Arthur Wyant]107-wyant ? Why , [poor Arthur]107-wyant had never been able to manage [his]107-wyant own poor little concerns with any sort of common sense or consistency ; and at the suggestion that [any one]374-any one might tire of [Jim]110-jim [he]107-wyant would be as indignant as [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter , and without [her]103-dexter power of controlling [her]103-dexter emotions . [Dexter Manford]103-dexter ? [Well -- [[Dexter Manford]103-dexter 's daughter]548-dexter manford 's daughter]547-well -- dexter manford 's daughter had to admit that it really was n't [his]107-wyant business if [[his]107-wyant step - son]549-his step - son 's marriage threatened to be a failure ; and besides , [Nona]102-nona knew how overwhelmed with work [[her]102-nona father]369-her father always was , and hesitated to lay this extra burden on [him]107-wyant . For it would be a burden . [Manford]102-nona was very fond of [Jim]110-jim ( as indeed [they]551-they all were ) , and had been extremely kind to [him]110-jim . " [I]110-jim fear [[my]110-jim bride]2710-my bride when [she]2710-my bride says [she]2710-my bride adores [me]110-jim , "[110-jim] [he]110-jim said , taking [Nona]102-nona into a brotherly embrace . As [he]110-jim stood there , sturdy and tawny , a trifle undersized , with [his]110-jim bright blue eyes and short blunt - nosed face , in which everything was so handsomely modelled and yet so safe and sober , [Nona]102-nona fell again to [her]102-nona dangerous wondering . Something had gone out of [his]110-jim face -- all the wild uncertain things , the violin , [model - making]559-model - making , inventing , dreaming , vacillating -- everything [she]102-nona had best loved except the twinkle in [his]110-jim sobered eyes . Whatever else was left now was all plain utility . Well , better so , no doubt -- when [one]325-one looked at [Lita]105-lita ! [Her]102-nona glance caught [[her]102-nona sister - in - law]331-her sister - in - law 's face in a mirror between two panels , and the reflection of [her]102-nona own beside it ; [she]102-nona winced a little at the contrast . At [her]102-nona best [she]102-nona had none of that milky translucence , or of the long lines which made [Lita]105-lita seem in perpetual motion , as a tremor of air lives in certain trees . Though [Nona]102-nona was as tall and nearly as slim , [she]102-nona seemed to [herself]102-nona to be built , while [Lita]105-lita was spun of spray and sunlight . Perhaps it was [Nona]102-nona 's general brownness -- [she]102-nona had [Dexter Manford]103-dexter 's brown crinkled hair , [his]110-jim strong black lashes setting [her]102-nona rather usual - looking gray eyes ; and the texture of [her]102-nona dusky healthy skin , compared to [Lita]105-lita 's , seemed rough and opaque . The comparison added to [her]102-nona general vague sense of discouragement . " It 's not one of [my]102-nona beauty days , "[102-nona] [she]102-nona thought . [Jim]110-jim was drawing [her]102-nona arm through [his]110-jim . " Come along , [[my]110-jim girl]2711-my girl . Is there going to be any lunch ? "[110-jim] [he]110-jim queried , turning toward [the dining - room]562-the dining - room . " Oh , probably . In [this house]2700-this house the same things always happen every day , "[105-lita] [Lita]105-lita averred with a slight grimace . " Well , [I]105-lita 'm glad lunch does -- on the days when [I]105-lita can make a dash up - [town]2627-town for it . "[105-lita] " On others [Lita]105-lita eats goldfish food , "[102-nona] [Nona]102-nona laughed . " Luncheon is served , [madam]2670-madam , "[563-the butler] [the butler]563-the butler announced . The meal , as usual under [Lita]105-lita 's roof , was one in which delicacies alternated with delays . [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter would have been driven out of [her]103-dexter mind by the uncertainties of the service and the incoherence of the _ menu _ ; but [she]103-dexter would have admitted that [no one]425-no one did a pilaff better than [[Lita]105-lita 's cook]565-lita 's cook . Gastronomic refinements were wasted on [Jim]110-jim , whose indifference to the possession of [the Wyant madeira]566-the wyant madeira was one of [[his]110-jim father]343-his father 's severest trials . ( " [I]110-jim should n't have been surprised if _ [you]105-lita _ had n't cared , [Nona]102-nona ; after all , [you]105-lita 're [a Manford]2715-a manford ; but that [a Wyant]2650-a wyant should n't have a respect for old wine ! "[110-jim] [Arthur Wyant]107-wyant often lamented to [her]105-lita . ) As for [Lita]105-lita , [she]105-lita either nibbled languidly at new health foods , or made ravenous inroads into the most indigestible dish presented to [her]105-lita . To - day [she]105-lita leaned back , dumb and indifferent , while [Jim]110-jim devoured what was put before [him]110-jim as if unaware that it was anything but canned beef ; and [Nona]102-nona watched [the two under guarded lids]568-the two under guarded lids . "[563-the butler] " No , [miss]2718-miss ; [Mrs. Wyant]110-jim . "[105-lita] [Lita]105-lita was on [her]105-lita feet , suddenly animated . " Oh , all right ... " Have the receiver brought in [here]2666-here , "[110-jim] [Jim]110-jim suggested ; but [she]105-lita brushed by without heeding . " That 's something new -- [Lita]105-lita sprinting for the telephone ! "[110-jim] [Jim]110-jim laughed . " And to talk to [father]2633-father ! "[110-jim] For the life of [her]102-nona , [Nona]102-nona could not have told why [she]102-nona stopped short with a vague sense of embarrassment . [Dexter Manford]103-dexter had always been very kind to [[his]570-his stepson 's wife]571-his stepson 's wife ; but then [everybody]2612-everybody was kind to [Lita]105-lita . [Jim]110-jim 's head was bent over the pilaff ; [he]110-jim took it down in quick undiscerning mouthfuls . " Well , [I]110-jim hope [he]305-her brother 's saying something that will amuse [her]105-lita : nothing seems to , nowadays . "[110-jim] It was on the tip of [Nona]102-nona 's tongue to rejoin : " Oh , yes ; it amuses [her]105-lita to say that nothing amuses [her]105-lita . "[110-jim] But [she]102-nona looked at [[her]102-nona brother]305-her brother 's face , faintly troubled under its surface serenity , and refrained . "[102-nona] " And for everything else -- when [she]105-lita chooses ! "[102-nona] The door opened and [Lita]105-lita sauntered back and dropped into [her]105-lita seat . " It seems [we]2721-we 're banqueting tonight at [the Palazzo Manford]2722-the palazzo manford . Did [you]110-jim know ? "[105-lita] " Did [I]110-jim know ? Why , [Lita]105-lita ! " [I]105-lita 'm afraid [I]105-lita 'm engaged . "[105-lita] [Jim]110-jim lifted [his]110-jim head with a jerk . " [You]105-lita were told a fortnight ago . "[110-jim] " Oh , a fortnight ! "[102-nona] [Nona]102-nona laughed a little nervously . [Lita]105-lita joined in the laugh . " Is n't [he]110-jim like [[his]110-jim mother]342-his mother ? "[105-lita] [she]105-lita shrugged . [Jim]110-jim was silent , and [[his]110-jim sister]377-his sister guessed that [he]110-jim was afraid to insist on the dinner engagement lest [he]110-jim should increase [[his]110-jim wife]389-his wife 's determination to ignore it . The same motive kept [Nona]102-nona from saying anything more ; and the lunch ended in a clatter of talk about other things . But what puzzled [Nona]102-nona was that [[her]102-nona father]369-her father 's communication to [Lita]105-lita should have concerned the fact that [she]389-his wife was dining at [[his]110-jim house]392-his house that night . It was unlike [Dexter Manford]103-dexter to remember the fact [himself]103-dexter ( as [Miss Bruss]101-miss bruss 's frantic telephoning had testified ) , and still more unlike [him]110-jim to remind [[his]110-jim wife 's guests]581-his wife 's guests , even if [he]110-jim knew who [they]581-his wife 's guests were to be -- which [he]110-jim seldom did . [Nona]102-nona pondered . " [They]2726-they must have been going somewhere together -- [he]110-jim told [me]102-nona [he]110-jim was engaged tonight -- and [Lita]105-lita 's in a temper because [they]2726-they ca n't . [She]102-nona wondered if it did as much for [Jim]110-jim . IV IT would have been hard , [Nona Manford]102-nona thought , to find a greater contrast than between [[Lita Wyant]105-lita 's house]582-lita wyant 's house and that at which , two hours later , [she]102-nona descended from [[Lita Wyant]105-lita 's smart [Brewster]134-brewster]583-lita wyant 's smart brewster . " [You]105-lita wo n't come , [Lita]105-lita ? "[299-the girl] [The girl]299-the girl paused , [her]299-the girl hand on the motor door . " [He]110-jim 'd like it awfully . "[105-lita] [Lita]105-lita waved one of [her]105-lita flower - hands and was off . [Nona]102-nona mounted the pock - marked brown steps . [The house]530-the house was [[old Mrs. Wyant]110-jim 's]586-old mrs. wyant 's , [a faded derelict habitation]587-a faded derelict habitation in [a street]588-a street past which fashion and business had long since flowed . After [[his]589-his mother]342-his mother 's death [Wyant]105-lita , from motives of economy , had divided [it]530-the house into [small flats]591-small flats . [He]589-his kept one for [himself]589-his , and in the one overhead lived [[his]589-his mother 's former companion]592-his mother 's former companion , [the dependent cousin who had been the cause of [his]589-his divorce]593-the dependent cousin who had been the cause of his divorce . [Wyant]105-lita had never married [her]342-his mother ; [he]589-his had never deserted [her]342-his mother ; that , to [Nona]102-nona 's mind , gave [one]325-one a fair notion of [his]589-his character . When [he]589-his was ill -- and [he]589-his had developed , rather early , a queer sort of nervous hypochondria -- [the cousin]488-the cousin came [downstairs]596-downstairs and nursed [him]589-his ; when [he]589-his was well [[his]589-his visitors]597-his visitors never saw [her]488-the cousin . But [she]488-the cousin was reported to attend to [his]589-his mending , keep some sort of order in [his]589-his accounts , and prevent [his]589-his falling a prey to the unscrupulous . [Pauline Manford]108-pauline said it was probably for the best . [She]108-pauline [herself]108-pauline would have thought it natural , and in fact proper , that [[her]108-pauline former husband]598-her former husband should have married [[his]598-her former husband cousin]599-his cousin ; as [he]598-her former husband had not , [she]108-pauline preferred to decide that since the divorce [they]600-they had been " [only friends]2728-only friends . "[108-pauline] The Wyant code was always a puzzle to [her]108-pauline . [She]108-pauline never met [the cousin]488-the cousin when [she]108-pauline called on [[her]108-pauline former husband]598-her former husband ; but [Jim]110-jim , two or three times a year , made it a point to ring the bell of [the upper flat]603-the upper flat , and at Christmas sent [its invisible tenant]604-its invisible tenant an azalea . [Nona]102-nona ran up the stairs to [Wyant]110-jim 's door . On the threshold [a thin gray - haired lady with a shadowy face]605-a thin gray - haired lady with a shadowy face awaited [her]102-nona . " Come in , do . "[299-the girl] [The girl]299-the girl looked sympathetically into the other 's dimly tragic eyes . " [Poor Exhibit A]136-exhibit ! [I]299-the girl 'm sorry [he]110-jim 's ill again . "[607-the older woman] [The older woman]607-the older woman smiled a worn smile , and vanished [upstairs]443-upstairs while [Nona]102-nona slipped off [her]102-nona furs . [The girl]299-the girl knew it would be useless to urge [cousin Eleanor]135-cousin eleanor to stay . If [one]325-one wished to see [her]299-the girl [one]325-one had to ring at [her]299-the girl own door . [[Arthur Wyant]107-wyant 's [shabby sitting - room]613-shabby sitting - room]612-arthur wyant 's shabby sitting - room was full of February sunshine , illustrated magazines , newspapers and cigar ashes . There were some books on shelves , shabby also : [Wyant]107-wyant had apparently once cared for them , and [his]107-wyant talk was still coloured by traces of early cultivation , especially when visitors like [Nona]102-nona or [Stan Heuston]137-heuston were with [him]107-wyant . But the range of [his]107-wyant allusions suggested that [he]107-wyant must have stopped reading years ago . Even novels were too great a strain on [his]107-wyant attention . As far back as [Nona]102-nona could remember [he]107-wyant had fared only on the popular magazines , picture - papers and [the weekly purveyors of social scandal]614-the weekly purveyors of social scandal . [He]107-wyant took an intense interest in the private affairs of [the world]303-the world [he]107-wyant had ceased to frequent , though [he]107-wyant always ridiculed this interest in talking to [Nona]102-nona or [Heuston]137-heuston . While [he]107-wyant sat there , deep in [his]107-wyant armchair , with bent shoulders , sunk head and clumsy bandaged foot , [Nona]102-nona saw [him]107-wyant , as [she]102-nona always did , as taller , slimmer , more handsomely upstanding than [any man [she]102-nona had ever known]616-any man she had ever known . [He]107-wyant stooped now , even when [he]107-wyant was on [his]107-wyant feet ; [he]107-wyant was prematurely aged ; and the fact perhaps helped to connect [him]107-wyant with [vanished institutions to which only [his]107-wyant first youth]617-vanished institutions to which only his first youth could have belonged . To [Nona]102-nona , at any rate , [he]107-wyant would always be [the Arthur Wyant of [the race - meeting group]619-the race - meeting group in the yellowing photograph on [his]107-wyant mantelpiece]618-the arthur wyant of the race - meeting group in the yellowing photograph on his mantelpiece : clad in the gray frock - coat and topper of the early ' eighties , and tallest in a tall line of the similarly garbed , behind [ladies with puffed sleeves and little hats tilting forward on elaborate hair]620-ladies with puffed sleeves and little hats tilting forward on elaborate hair . How peaceful , smiling and unhurried [they]621-they all seemed ! [Nona]102-nona never looked at [them]621-they without a pang of regret that [she]102-nona had not been born in those spacious days of dogcarts , victorias , leisurely tennis and afternoon calls ... [Wyant]107-wyant 's face , even more than [his]107-wyant figure , related [him]107-wyant to that past : the small shapely head , the crisp hair grown thin on a narrow slanting forehead , the eyes in which a twinkle still lingered , eyes probably blue when the hair was brown , but now faded with the rest , and the slight fair moustache above an uncertain ironic mouth . [A romantic figure]622-a romantic figure ; or rather the faded photograph of [one]325-one . Yes ; perhaps [Arthur Wyant]107-wyant had always been faded -- like a charming reflection in a sallow mirror . And all that length of limb and beauty of port had been meant for [some other man]624-some other man , [a man to whom the things had really happened]625-a man to whom the things had really happened which [Wyant]107-wyant had only dreamed . [[His]107-wyant visitor]626-his visitor , though of the same stock , could never have inspired such conjectures . [Stanley Heuston]137-heuston was much younger -- in the middle thirties -- and most things about [him]137-heuston were middling : height , complexion , features . But [he]137-heuston had a strong forehead , [his]137-heuston mouth was curved for power and mockery , and only [his]137-heuston small quick eyes betrayed the uncertainty and lassitude inherited from [a Wyant mother]627-a wyant mother . [Wyant]107-wyant , at [Nona]102-nona 's approach , held out a dry feverish hand . " Well , this is luck ! [Stan]137-heuston was just getting ready to fly at [[your]102-nona mother]2610-your mother 's approach , and [you]102-nona turn up instead ! "[107-wyant] [Heuston]137-heuston got to [his]137-heuston feet , and greeted [Nona]102-nona somewhat ceremoniously . " Perhaps [I]137-heuston 'd better fly all the same , "[137-heuston] [he]137-heuston said in a singularly agreeable voice . [His]137-heuston eyes were intent on [the girl]299-the girl 's . [She]102-nona made a slight gesture , not so much to detain or dismiss as to signify [her]102-nona complete indifference . " Is [n't [mother]2638-mother]2733-n't mother coming presently ? "[102-nona] [she]102-nona said , addressing the question to [Wyant]107-wyant . " No ; [I]102-nona 'm moved on till tomorrow . There must have been some big upheaval to make [her]2638-mother change [her]2638-mother plans at the last minute . Sit down and tell [us]2735-us all about it . "[102-nona] " [I]102-nona do n't know of any upheaval . There 's only the dinner - dance for [Amalasuntha]117-amalasuntha this evening . "[102-nona] " Oh , but that sort of thing is in [[your]299-the girl mother]2610-your mother 's stride . [You]299-the girl underrate [her]2638-mother capacity . "[102-nona] " Ah , well , [I]299-the girl suppose [he]137-heuston 's not enough of a novelty . Or not up - to - date enough ; _ [your]299-the girl _ dates . "[299-the girl] [The girl]299-the girl did not take this up , and after a moment [Wyant]105-lita continued , in [his]633-his half - mocking half - querulous voice : " Or is it that [he]137-heuston is n't ' psychic ' enough ? That 's the latest , is n't it ? "[102-nona] [Nona]102-nona brought it out between parched lips . [Her]102-nona gaze turned from [Wyant]105-lita to the coals smouldering in the grate . [She]102-nona did not want to face [any one]374-any one just then . " Well , it seems there 's going to be a gigantic muck - raking -- one of the worst [we]2742-we 've had yet . Into this Mahatma business ; [you]299-the girl know , [the nigger chap [[your]299-the girl mother]2610-your mother 's always talking about]2743-the nigger chap your mother 's always talking about . What it says is n't a patch on the real facts , [Stan]137-heuston tells [me]102-nona . It seems the goings - on in [that School of Oriental Thought]2746-that school of oriental thought -- what does [he]137-heuston call [the place]2747-the place : [Dawnside?--have]138-dawnside?--have reached such a point that [the Grant Lindons]139-the lindons , whose girl has been making a ' retreat ' [there]2641-there , or whatever [they]2749-they call it , are out to have a thorough probing . [They]2749-they say [the police]2750-the police do n't want to move because [so many people [we]2752-we know]2751-so many people we know are mixed up in it ; but [Lindon]140-bee 's back is up , and [he]137-heuston swears [he]137-heuston wo n't rest till [he]137-heuston gets the case before [the Grand Jury]2753-the grand jury ... "[102-nona] As [Wyant]105-lita talked , the weight lifted from [Nona]102-nona 's breast . Much [she]102-nona cared for [the Mahatma]123-the mahatma , or for [the Grant Lindons]139-the lindons ! [Stuffy old - fashioned people]635-stuffy old - fashioned people -- [she]102-nona did n't wonder [Bee Lindon]140-bee had broken away from [such parents]636-such parents -- though [she]140-bee was [a silly fool]637-a silly fool , no doubt . Besides , [the Mahatma]123-the mahatma certainly had reduced [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter 's hips -- and made [her]103-dexter less nervous too : for [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter sometimes was nervous , in spite of [her]103-dexter breathless pursuit of repose . Not , of course , in the same querulous uncontrolled way as poor [Arthur Wyant]107-wyant , who had [never been taught poise , or mental uplift , or being in tune with the Infinite]638-never been taught poise , or mental uplift , or being in tune with the infinite ; but rather as [one agitated by the incessant effort to be calm]639-one agitated by the incessant effort to be calm . And in that respect [the Mahatma]123-the mahatma 's rhythmic exercises had without doubt been helpful . No ; [Nona]102-nona did n't care a fig for scandals about [the School of Oriental Thought]640-the school of oriental thought . And the relief of finding that the subject [she]102-nona had dreaded to hear broached had probably never even come to [Wyant]107-wyant 's ears , gave [her]102-nona a reaction of light - heartedness . There were moments when [Nona]102-nona felt oppressed by responsibilities and anxieties not of [her]102-nona age , apprehensions that [she]102-nona could not shake off and yet had not enough experience of life to know how to meet . [One or two of [[her]102-nona girl friends]642-her girl friends]641-one or two of her girl friends -- in the brief intervals between whirls and thrills -- had confessed to the same vague disquietude . It was as if , in the beaming determination of [the middle - aged]643-the middle - aged , one and all of [them]643-the middle - aged , to ignore sorrow and evil , " think [them]643-the middle - aged away "[643-the middle - aged] as superannuated bogies , survivals of some obsolete European superstition unworthy of enlightened Americans , to whom [plumbing and dentistry had given higher standards]644-plumbing and dentistry had given higher standards , and bi - focal glasses a clearer view of [the universe]645-the universe -- as if [the demons [the elder generation]647-the elder generation ignored , baulked of [their]647-the elder generation natural prey]646-the demons the elder generation ignored , baulked of their natural prey , had cast [their]647-the elder generation hungry shadow over [the young]648-the young . After all , [somebody in every family]649-somebody in every family had to remember now and then that such things as wickedness , suffering and death had not yet been banished from [the earth]650-the earth ; and with all [those bright - complexioned white - haired mothers]651-those bright - complexioned white - haired mothers mailed in massage and optimism , and behaving as if [they]651-those bright - complexioned white - haired mothers had never heard of anything but the Good and the Beautiful , perhaps [[their]651-those bright - complexioned white - haired mothers children]652-their children had to serve as vicarious sacrifices . There were hours when [Nona Manford]102-nona , bewildered little Iphigenia , uneasily argued in this way : others when youth and inexperience reasserted [themselves]653-themselves , and the load slipped from [her]102-nona , and [she]102-nona wondered why [she]102-nona did n't always believe , like [[her]102-nona elders]654-her elders , that [one]325-one had only to be brisk , benevolent and fond to prevail against the powers of darkness . [She]102-nona felt this relief now ; but a vague restlessness remained with [her]102-nona , and to ease it , and prove to [herself]102-nona that [she]102-nona was not nervous , [she]102-nona mentioned to [Wyant]107-wyant that [she]102-nona had just been lunching with [Jim]110-jim and [Lita]105-lita . [Wyant]105-lita brightened , as [he]107-wyant always did at [[his]107-wyant son]408-his son 's name . " [Poor old Jim]110-jim ! V THE door of [[his]369-her father private office]681-his private office clicked on [a withdrawing client]682-a withdrawing client , and [Dexter Manford]103-dexter , giving [his]369-her father vigorous shoulders a shake , rose from [his]369-her father desk and stood irresolute . " [I]369-her father must get out to [Cedarledge]5-cedarledge for some golf on Saturday , "[369-her father] [he]369-her father thought .
