" Oh , what rot ! "[369-her father] [he]369-her father exclaimed . [His]369-her father day had been as all [his]369-her father days were now : a starting in with a great sense of pressure , importance and authority -- and a drop at the close into staleness and futility . The evening before , [he]369-her father had stopped to see [[his]369-her father doctor]687-his doctor and been told that [he]369-her father was over - working , and needed a nerve - tonic and a change of scene . " Cruise to [the West Indies]25-the west indies , or something of the sort . Could n't [you]369-her father get away for three or four weeks ? No ? Well , more golf then , anyhow . "[369-her father] Getting away from things ; the perpetual evasion , moral , mental , physical , which [he]369-her father heard preached , and saw practised , everywhere about [him]369-her father , except where money - making was concerned ! [He]369-her father , [Dexter Manford]103-dexter , who had been brought up on [a Minnesota farm]688-a minnesota farm , paid [his]369-her father own way through [the State College at [Delos]26-delos]689-the state college at delos , and [his]369-her father subsequent course in [the Harvard Law School]690-the harvard law school ; and who , ever since , had been working at the top of [his]369-her father pitch with no more sense of strain , no more desire for evasion ( shirking , [he]369-her father called it ) than [a healthy able - bodied man of fifty]691-a healthy able - bodied man of fifty had a right to feel ! If [his]369-her father task had been mere money - getting [he]369-her father might have known -- and acknowledged -- weariness . But [he]369-her father gloried in [his]369-her father profession , in its labours and difficulties as well as its rewards , it satisfied [him]369-her father intellectually and gave [him]369-her father that calm sense of mastery -- mastery over [himself]369-her father and [others]2774-others -- known only to [those who are doing what [they]693-those who are doing what they were born to do were born to do]693-those who are doing what they were born to do . Of course , at every stage of [his]369-her father career -- and never more than now , on its slippery pinnacle -- [he]369-her father had suffered the thousand irritations inseparable from a hard - working life : the trifles which waste [one]325-one 's time , the fools who consume [one]325-one 's patience , the tricky failure of the best - laid plans , the endless labour of rolling human stupidity up [the steep hill of understanding]696-the steep hill of understanding . But until lately these things had been a stimulus : it had amused [him]369-her father to shake off trifles , baffle bores , circumvent failure , and exercise [his]369-her father mental muscles in persuading [stupid people]697-stupid people to do intelligent things . There was pioneer blood in [him]369-her father : [he]369-her father was used to starting out every morning to hack [his]369-her father way through a fresh growth of prejudices and obstacles ; and though [he]369-her father liked [his]369-her father big retaining fees [he]369-her father liked arguing a case even better . Professionally , [he]369-her father was used to intellectual loneliness , and no longer minded it . Outside of [his]369-her father profession [he]369-her father had a brain above the average , but a general education hardly up to it ; and the discrepancy between what [he]369-her father would have been capable of enjoying had [his]369-her father mind been prepared for it , and what it could actually take in , made [him]369-her father modest and almost shy in what [he]369-her father considered cultivated society . [He]369-her father had long believed [[his]369-her father wife]389-his wife to be cultivated because [she]389-his wife had fits of book - buying and there was [an expensively bound library in [the New York house]700-the new york house]699-an expensively bound library in the new york house . In [his]369-her father raw youth , in the old [Delos]26-delos days , [he]369-her father had got together [a little library of [his]369-her father own in which [Robert Ingersoll]148-robert ingersoll 's lectures represented science , the sermons of [the Reverend Frank Gunsaulus]149-the reverend frank gunsaulus of [Chicago]27-chicago]701-a little library of his own in which robert ingersoll 's lectures represented science , the sermons of the reverend frank gunsaulus of chicago , theology , [John Burroughs]150-john burroughs , natural history , and [Jared Sparks]151-jared sparks and Bancroft almost the whole of history . [He]369-her father had gradually discovered the inadequacy of these guides , but without ever having done much to replace them . Now and then , when [he]369-her father was not too tired , and had the rare chance of a quiet evening , [he]369-her father picked up a book from [Pauline]108-pauline 's table ; but the works [she]108-pauline acquired were so heterogeneous , and of such unequal value , that [he]369-her father rarely found one worth reading . [Mrs. Tallentyre]152-mrs. tallentyre 's " [Voltaire]153-voltaire "[152-mrs. tallentyre] had been a revelation : [he]369-her father discovered , to [his]369-her father surprise , that [he]369-her father had never really known who [Voltaire]153-voltaire was , or what sort of [a world [he]369-her father had lived in]702-a world he had lived in , and why [his]369-her father name had survived it . After that , [Manford]108-pauline decided to start in on a course of European history , and got as far as taking the first volume of [Macaulay]154-macaulay up to bed . But [he]369-her father was tired at night , and found [Macaulay]154-macaulay 's periods too long ( though [their]703-their eloquence appealed to [his]369-her father forensic instinct ): and there had never been time for that course of history . In [his]369-her father early wedded days , before [he]369-her father knew much of [[his]369-her father wife]389-his wife 's world , [he]369-her father had dreamed of quiet evenings at [home]2630-home , when [Pauline]108-pauline would read instructive books aloud while [he]369-her father sat by the fire and turned over [his]369-her father briefs in [some quiet inner chamber of [his]369-her father mind]706-some quiet inner chamber of his mind . But [Pauline]108-pauline had never known [any one who wanted to be read aloud]707-any one who wanted to be read aloud to except [children getting over infantile complaints]708-children getting over infantile complaints . [She]108-pauline regarded the desire almost as a symptom of illness , and decided that [Dexter]103-dexter needed " rousing , "[108-pauline] and that [she]108-pauline must do more to amuse [him]369-her father . As soon as [she]108-pauline was able after [Nona]102-nona 's birth [she]108-pauline girt [herself]108-pauline up for this new duty ; and from that day [Manford]102-nona 's life , out of office hours , had been one of almost incessant social activity . At first the endless going out had bewildered , then for a while amused and flattered [him]369-her father , then gradually grown to be a soothing routine , a sort of mild drug - taking after the high pressure of professional hours ; but of late it had become simply a bore , a duty to be persisted in because -- as [he]369-her father had at last discovered -- [Pauline]108-pauline could not live without it . After twenty years of marriage [he]369-her father was only just beginning to exercise [his]369-her father intellectual acumen on [[his]369-her father wife]389-his wife . The thought of [Pauline]108-pauline made [him]369-her father glance at [his]369-her father clock : [she]108-pauline would be coming in a moment . [He]369-her father unhooked the receiver again , and named , impatiently , the same number as before . " Out , [you]108-pauline say ? Still ? "[369-her father] ( The same stupid voice making the same stupid answer ! ) " Oh , no ; no matter . [I]369-her father say _ it 's no matter _ , "[369-her father] [he]369-her father almost shouted , replacing the receiver . Of [all idiotic servants--]710-all idiotic servants-- ! " Damn that dinner , "[735-he] [he]735-he swore to [himself]735-he . [He]735-he turned to the telephone , unhooked it for the third time , and called for the same number . [He]735-he had not yet forgotten the day when , after one of [his]735-he first legal successes , [he]735-he had installed a bathroom in [[[his]735-he mother]342-his mother 's house at [Delos]26-delos]744-his mother 's house at delos , and all [the neighbours]745-the neighbours had driven in from miles around to see [it]746-it . It was not the splendour of [[his]735-he house]392-his house that oppressed [him]735-he but the sense of the corporative bonds it imposed . It seemed part of an elaborate social and domestic structure , put together with the baffling ingenuity of certain bird's - nests of which [he]735-he had seen the pictures . [His]735-he own career , [Pauline]108-pauline 's multiple activities , the problem of [poor Arthur Wyant]107-wyant , [Nona]102-nona , [Jim]110-jim , [Lita Wyant]105-lita , [the Mahatma]123-the mahatma , [the tiresome Grant Lindons]139-the lindons , the perennial and inevitable Amalasuntha , for whom [the house]530-the house was being illuminated tonight -- all were strands woven into the very pile of the carpet [he]735-he trod on [his]735-he way up [the stairs]749-the stairs . [VI PAULINE MANFORD]108-pauline sent a satisfied glance down the table . It was on such occasions that [she]108-pauline visibly reaped [her]108-pauline reward . [No one else in [New York]2-new york]753-no one else in new york had so accomplished [a cook]754-a cook , such smoothly running service , a dinner - table so softly yet brightly lit , or such skill in grouping about it persons not only eminent in wealth or fashion , but likely to find pleasure in [each other]2681-each other 's society . The intimate reunion , of [the not - more - than - the - Muses kind]756-the not - more - than - the - muses kind , was not [Pauline]108-pauline 's affair . [She]108-pauline was aware of this , and seldom made the attempt -- though , when [she]108-pauline did , [she]108-pauline was never able to discover why it was not a success . But in the organizing and administering of a big dinner [she]108-pauline was conscious of mastery . Not the stupid big dinner of old days , when [the " crowned heads "]2818-the " crowned heads "[108-pauline] used to be treated like a caste apart , and everlastingly invited to meet [each other]2681-each other through a whole monotonous season : [Pauline]108-pauline was too modern for that . [She]108-pauline excelled in a judicious blending of [Wall Street]16-wall street and [Bohemia]29-bohemia , and [her]108-pauline particular art lay in [her]108-pauline selection of the latter element . Of course there were [Bohemians]758-bohemians and [Bohemians]758-bohemians ; as [she]108-pauline had once remarked to [Nona]102-nona , [people]437-people were n't always amusing just because [they]437-people were clever , or dull just because [they]437-people were rich -- though at the last clause [Nona]102-nona had screwed up [her]102-nona nose incredulously ... Well , even [Nona]102-nona would be satisfied tonight , [Pauline]108-pauline thought . It was n't [everybody who would have been bold enough to ask [a social reformer like [Parker Greg]160-parker greg]762-a social reformer like parker greg with [the very people least disposed to encourage social reform]763-the very people least disposed to encourage social reform , nor [a young composer like [Torfried Lobb]125-torfried lobb]764-a young composer like torfried lobb ( a disciple of " [The Six "]2819-the six "[125-torfried lobb] ) with [all those stolid opera - goers]765-all those stolid opera - goers , nor that disturbing [Tommy Ardwin]131-ardwin , [the Cubist decorator]766-the cubist decorator , with the owners of [the most expensive " period houses "[766-the cubist decorator] in [Fifth Avenue]30-fifth avenue]767-the most expensive " period houses " in fifth avenue]761-everybody who would have been bold enough to ask a social reformer like parker greg with the very people least disposed to encourage social reform , nor a young composer like torfried lobb ( a disciple of " the six " ) with all those stolid opera - goers , nor that disturbing tommy ardwin , the cubist decorator , with the owners of the most expensive " period houses " in fifth avenue . [Pauline]108-pauline was not a bit afraid of such combinations . [She]108-pauline knew in advance that at one of [her]108-pauline dinners everything would " go"--it[108-pauline] always did . And [her]108-pauline success amused and exhilarated [her]108-pauline so much that , even tonight , though [she]108-pauline had come down oppressed with problems , [they]768-they slipped from [her]108-pauline before [she]108-pauline even had time to remind [herself]108-pauline that [they]768-they were nonexistent . [She]108-pauline had only to look at the faces gathered about that subdued radiance of old silver and scattered flowers to be sure of it . There , at the other end of the table , was [[her]108-pauline husband]556-her husband 's dark head , comely and resolute in its vigorous middle - age ; on [his]556-her husband right [the Marchesa di San Fedele]428-the marchesa di san fedele , the famous [San Fedele]71-san fedele pearls illuminating [her]108-pauline inconspicuous black ; on [his]556-her husband left the handsome [Mrs. Herman Toy]161-mrs. toy , magnanimously placed there by [Pauline]108-pauline because [she]108-pauline knew that [Manford]108-pauline was said to be " taken "[108-pauline] by [her]108-pauline , and [she]108-pauline wanted [him]556-her husband to be in good - humour that evening . To measure [her]108-pauline own competence [she]108-pauline had only to take in [this group]771-this group , already settling down to an evening 's enjoyment , and then let [her]108-pauline glance travel on to [the others]772-the others , [the young and handsome women]773-the young and handsome women , [the well - dressed confident - looking men]774-the well - dressed confident - looking men . [Nona]102-nona , grave yet eager , was talking to [[Manford]102-nona 's legal rival]775-manford 's legal rival , [the brilliant [Alfred Cosby]155-cosby , who was known to have said [she]776-the brilliant alfred cosby , who was known to have said she was the cleverest girl in new york was [the cleverest girl in [New York]2-new york]777-the cleverest girl in new york]776-the brilliant alfred cosby , who was known to have said she was the cleverest girl in new york . "[784-the bishop] The words were balm to [Pauline]108-pauline . Every syllable carried conviction : all was right with [[her]108-pauline world]790-her world and [the Bishop]784-the bishop 's ! And what a lesson in tolerance and good - will to the discordant world [she]108-pauline was trying to reform ! [Nona]102-nona , half - way down the table , viewed [its guests]797-its guests from another angle . [She]102-nona had come back depressed rather than fortified from [her]102-nona flying visit to [[her]102-nona father]369-her father . There were days when [Manford]102-nona liked to be " surprised "[369-her father] at [the office]2608-the office ; when [he]369-her father and [[his]369-her father daughter]341-his daughter had [their]801-their little jokes together over these clandestine visits . But this one had not come off in that spirit . [She]102-nona had found [Manford]102-nona tired and slightly irritable ; [Nona]102-nona , before [he]369-her father had time to tell [her]102-nona of [[her]102-nona mother]276-her mother 's visit , caught a lingering whiff of [Pauline]108-pauline 's cool hygienic scent , and wondered nervously what could have happened to make [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter break through [her]103-dexter tightly packed engagements , and dash down to [[[her]103-dexter husband]556-her husband 's office]804-her husband 's office . But what could have obliged [her]102-nona to see [Manford]102-nona so suddenly , when [they]805-they were to meet at dinner that evening ? [The girl]299-the girl had asked no questions : [she]299-the girl knew that [Manford]102-nona , true to [his]556-her husband profession , preferred putting [them]807-them . " [The Mahatma]123-the mahatma , probably . "[102-nona] [Nona]102-nona knew how [[her]102-nona mother]276-her mother hated a fuss : how vulgar and unchristian [she]276-her mother always thought it . For of course that dream of [a Western farm]851-a western farm was all rubbish . What [he]852-his really wanted was a life in which professional interests as far - reaching and absorbing as [his]852-his own were somehow impossibly combined with great stretches of country quiet , books , horses and [children]853-children -- ah , [children]853-children ! [Boys of [his]852-his own]855-boys of his own -- teaching [them]855-boys of his own all sorts of country things ; taking [them]855-boys of his own for long trudges , telling [them]855-boys of his own about trees and plants and birds -- watching the squirrels , feeding the robins and thrushes in winter ; and coming [home]2630-home in the dusk to firelight , lamplight , a tea - table groaning with jolly things , all [the boys]857-the boys and [girls]858-girls ( [girls]858-girls too , [more little Nonas]860-more little nonas ) grouped around , hungry and tingling from [their]855-boys of his own long tramp -- and [a woman]2655-a woman lifting a calm face from [her]2655-a woman book : [a woman who looked so absurdly young to be [[their]863-their mother]864-their mother]862-a woman who looked so absurdly young to be their mother ; so-- " [You]114-the marchesa 're looking at [[Jim]110-jim 's wife]2874-jim 's wife ? [Father - in - law]2876-father - in - law , [I]114-the marchesa mean-- "[114-the marchesa] Silent ! The word sent [him]865-you off again . " [I]117-amalasuntha 'm used to [Roman palaces]2877-roman palaces ! "[117-amalasuntha] [VII]171-vii " AT least [you]102-nona 'll take a turn ? "[137-heuston] [Heuston]137-heuston said ; and [Nona]102-nona , yielding , joined [the dancers balancing with slow steps about the shining floor]878-the dancers balancing with slow steps about the shining floor . Dancing meant nothing ; it was like breathing ; what would [one]325-one be doing if [one]325-one were n't dancing ? [She]102-nona could not refuse without seeming singular ; it was simpler to acquiesce , and lose [one]325-one 's self among [the couples absorbed in the same complicated ritual]882-the couples absorbed in the same complicated ritual . [The floor]883-the floor was full , but not crowded : [Pauline]108-pauline always saw to that . It was easy to calculate in advance , for every one [she]108-pauline asked always accepted , and [she]108-pauline and [Maisie Bruss]104-maisie , in making out the list , allotted the requisite space per couple as carefully as if [they]884-they had been counting cubic feet in [a hospital]885-a hospital . The ventilation was perfect too ; neither draughts nor stuffiness . [One]325-one had almost the sense of dancing out of doors , under some equable southern sky . [Nona]102-nona , aware of what it cost to produce this illusion , marvelled once more at [[her]102-nona tireless mother]887-her tireless mother . " Is n't [she]887-her tireless mother wonderful ? "[102-nona] [[Even Mrs. Dexter Manford]103-dexter 's perfectly run house]942-even mrs. dexter manford 's perfectly run house was not a particularly appetizing place to return to at four o'clock on the morning after a dance . [The last motor]943-the last motor was gone , the last overcoat and opera cloak had vanished from [hall]944-hall and dressing - rooms , and only one hanging lamp lit the dusky tapestries and the monumental balustrade of the staircase . But empty cocktail glasses and ravaged cigar - boxes littered the hall tables , wisps of torn tulle and trampled orchids strewed the stair - carpet , and the thicket of forced lilacs and Japanese plums in front of [the lift]945-the lift drooped mournfully in the hot air . [Nona]102-nona , letting [herself]102-nona in with [her]102-nona latch - key , scanned the scene with a feeling of disgust . What was it all for , and what was left when it was over ? [VIII]181-viii THE morning after a party in [[her]958-her own house]962-her own house [Pauline Manford]108-pauline always accorded [herself]958-her an extra half - hour 's rest ; but on this occasion [she]958-her employed it in lying awake and wearily reckoning up the next day 's tasks . Disenchantment had succeeded to the night 's glamour . The glamour of balls never did last : they so quickly became a matter for [those domestic undertakers]963-those domestic undertakers , [the charwomen]964-the charwomen , [housemaids]965-housemaids and [electricians]966-electricians . And in this case the taste of pleasure had soured early . When the doors were thrown open on the beflowered supper tables not [one of [[the hostess]968-the hostess 's family]969-the hostess 's family]967-one of the hostess 's family was left to marshal [the guests]970-the guests to [[their]970-the guests places]971-their places ! [[Her]108-pauline husband]556-her husband , [[her]108-pauline daughter]917-her daughter and [son]974-son , [[her]108-pauline son 's wife]975-her son 's wife -- all had deserted [her]958-her . It needed , in that chill morning vigil , all [Pauline]108-pauline 's self - control to banish the memory . Not that [she]958-her wanted any of [them]976-them to feel under any obligation -- [she]958-her was all for personal freedom , self - expression , or whatever [they]976-them called it nowadays -- but still , a ball was a ball , [a host]977-a host was [a host]977-a host . It was too bad of [Dexter]103-dexter , really ; and of [Jim]110-jim too . On [Lita]105-lita of course [no one]425-no one could count : that was part of the pose [people]437-people found so fascinating . But [Jim]110-jim -- [Jim]110-jim and [Nona]102-nona to forsake [her]958-her ! What a ridiculous position it had put [her]958-her in -- but no , [she]958-her must n't think of that now , or those nasty little wrinkles would creep back about [her]958-her eyes . [The masseuse]981-the masseuse had warned [her]958-her ... Gracious ! At what time was [the masseuse]981-the masseuse due ? [She]958-her stretched out [her]958-her hand , turned on the light by the bed ( for the windows were still closely darkened ) , and reached for what [Maisie Bruss]104-maisie called the night - list : an upright porcelain tablet on which [the secretary]281-the secretary recorded , for nocturnal study , the principal " fixtures "[104-maisie] of the coming day . Today they were so numerous that [Miss Bruss]101-miss bruss 's tight script had hardly contrived to squeeze them in . Foremost , of course , poor Exhibit A , moved on from yesterday ; then a mysterious appointment with [Amalasuntha]117-amalasuntha , just before lunch : something urgent , [she]101-miss bruss had hinted . Today of all days ! [Amalasuntha]117-amalasuntha was so tactless at times . And then that [Mahatma]123-the mahatma business : since [Dexter]103-dexter was inflexible , [[his]981-the masseuse wife]389-his wife had made up [her]389-his wife mind to appeal to [the Lindons]139-the lindons . It would be awkward , undoubtedly -- and [she]958-her did so hate things that were awkward . Any form of untidiness , moral or material , was unpleasant to [her]958-her ; but something must be done , and at once . [She]958-her [herself]958-her hardly knew why [she]958-her felt so apprehensive , so determined that the matter should have no sequel ; except that , if anything _ did _ go wrong , it would upset all [her]958-her plans for a rest - cure , for new exercises , for all sorts of promised ways of prolonging youth , activity and slenderness , and would oblige [her]958-her to find a new Messiah who would tell [her]958-her [she]958-her was psychic . But the most pressing item on [her]958-her list was [her]958-her address that very afternoon to [the National Mothers ' Day Association]985-the national mothers ' day association -- or , no ; was n't it [the Birth Control League]986-the birth control league ? Nonsense ! That was [her]958-her speech at the banquet next week : a big affair at [the St. Regis]987-the st. regis for [a group of International Birth - controllers]988-a group of international birth - controllers . Wakeful as [she]958-her felt , [she]958-her must be half asleep to have muddled up [her]958-her engagements like that ! [She]958-her extinguished the lamp and sank hopefully to [her]958-her pillow -- perhaps now sleep would really come . But [her]958-her bed - lamp seemed to have a double switch , and putting it out in [the room]317-the room only turned it on in [her]958-her head . Well , [she]958-her would try reciting scraps of [her]958-her Mothers ' Day address : [she]958-her seldom spoke in public , but when [she]958-her did [she]958-her took the affair seriously , and tried to be at once winning and impressive . [She]958-her and [Maisie]104-maisie had gone carefully over the typed copy ; and [she]958-her was sure it was all right ; but [she]958-her liked getting the more effective passages by heart -- it brought [her]958-her nearer to [[her]958-her audience]990-her audience to lean forward and speak intimately , without having to revert every few minutes to the text . " Was there ever a hearth or a heart -- [a mother]497-a mother 's heart -- that was n't big enough for all [the babies God]2933-the babies god wants it to hold ? Of course there are days when [the mother]2934-the mother is so fagged out that [she]2934-the mother thinks [she]2934-the mother 'd give [the world]303-the world if there were nothing at all to do in [the nursery]2936-the nursery , and [she]2934-the mother could just sit still with folded hands . But the only time when there 's nothing at all for [a mother]497-a mother to do in [the nursery]2936-the nursery is when there 's a little coffin there . It 's all quiet enough _ then _ ... as [some of [us]2940-us here]2939-some of us here know ... "[991-the audience] ( Pause , and a few tears in [the audience]991-the audience . ) " Not that [we]2940-us want [the modern mother]2941-the modern mother to wear [herself]2941-the modern mother out : no indeed ! [The babies]2942-the babies [themselves]2942-the babies have n't any use for [worn - out mothers]2943-worn - out mothers ! And the first thing to be considered is what [the babies]2942-the babies want , is n't it ? "[991-the audience] ( Pause -- smiles in [the audience]991-the audience ) ... What on earth was [Amalasuntha]117-amalasuntha coming to bother [her]117-amalasuntha about ? More money , of course -- but [she]117-amalasuntha really could n't pay all that wretched [Michelangelo]182-michelangelo 's debts . There would soon be debts nearer [home]2630-home if [Lita]105-lita went on dressing so extravagantly , and perpetually having [her]105-lita jewellery reset . It cost almost as much nowadays to reset jewels as to buy new ones , and those emeralds ... At that hour of the morning things did tend to look ash - coloured ; and [she]105-lita felt that [her]105-lita optimism had never been so sorely strained since the year when [she]105-lita had had to read [Proust]183-proust , learn a new dance - step , master Oriental philosophy , and decide whether [she]117-amalasuntha should really bob [her]117-amalasuntha hair , or only do it to look so . [She]117-amalasuntha had come victoriously through those ordeals ; but what if worse lay ahead ? "[117-amalasuntha] It was well after three o'clock when [Pauline]108-pauline came down [the Lindons]139-the lindons ' door - step and said to [[her]108-pauline chauffeur]1003-her chauffeur : " To [Mr. Wyant]107-wyant 's . "[108-pauline] And [she]108-pauline had still to crowd in [her]108-pauline eurythmic exercises ( put off from the morning ) , and be ready at half - past four , bathed , waved and apparelled , for the Mothers ' Day Meeting , which was to take place in [[her]108-pauline own ball - room]1004-her own ball - room , with a giant tea to follow . Certainly , no amount of " mental deep - breathing , "[108-pauline] and all the other exercises in serenity , could combat the nervous apprehension produced by this breathless New [York]1-york life . Today [she]108-pauline really felt it to be too much for [her]108-pauline : [she]108-pauline leaned back and closed [her]108-pauline lids with a sigh . But [she]108-pauline was jerked back to consciousness by the traffic - control signal , which had immobilized the motor just when every moment was so precious . The result of [every one]1005-every one 's being in such a hurry to get everywhere was that [nobody]2926-nobody could get anywhere . [She]108-pauline looked across the triple row of motors in line with [hers]108-pauline , and saw in each ( as if in a vista of mirrors ) [an expensively dressed woman like [herself]108-pauline]1007-an expensively dressed woman like herself , leaning forward in the same attitude of repressed impatience , the same nervous frown of hurry on [her]108-pauline brow . Oh , if only [she]108-pauline could remember to relax ! But how could one , with everything going wrong as it was today ? The visit to [Fanny Lindon]157-fanny lindon had been an utter failure . [Pauline]108-pauline had apparently overestimated [her]108-pauline influence on [the Lindons]139-the lindons , and that discovery in itself was rather mortifying . [The Mahatma]123-the mahatma was one of [the leaders of the new movement]1053-the leaders of the new movement : the Return to Purity , [he]1054-he called it . As [she]108-pauline turned toward [[her]108-pauline audience]990-her audience a factitious serenity descended on [her]108-pauline . [She]108-pauline had done it ! [She]108-pauline had pulled off [her]108-pauline effect from the very jaws of disaster . Only the swift instinct of recovery had enabled [her]108-pauline , before it was too late , to pass off the first sentences of [her]108-pauline other address , [her]108-pauline Birth Control speech , as the bold exordium of [her]108-pauline hymn to motherhood ! [She]108-pauline paused a moment , still inwardly breathless , yet already sure enough of [herself]108-pauline to smile back at [Nona]102-nona across [[her]108-pauline unsuspecting audience]1077-her unsuspecting audience -- sure enough to note that [her]108-pauline paradoxical opening had had a much greater effect than [she]108-pauline could have hoped to produce by the phrases with which [she]108-pauline had meant to begin . A hint for future oratory-- Only -- the inward nervousness subsisted . The discovery that [she]108-pauline could lose not only [her]108-pauline self - control but [her]108-pauline memory , the very sense of what [she]108-pauline was saying , was like a hand of ice pointing to an undecipherable warning . Nervousness , fatigue , brain - exhaustion ... had [her]108-pauline fight against [them]1078-them been vain ? What was the use of all the months and years of patient Taylorized effort against the natural human fate : against anxiety , sorrow , old age -- if [their]1078-them menace was to reappear whenever events slipped from [her]108-pauline control ? The address ended in applause and admiring exclamations . [She]108-pauline had won [her]108-pauline way straight to those trustful hearts , still full of personal memories of a rude laborious life , or in which its stout tradition lingered on in spite of motors , money and the final word in plumbing . [Pauline]108-pauline , after the dispersal of [the Mothers]1045-the mothers , had gone up to [[her]108-pauline room]960-her room still dazed by the narrowness of [her]108-pauline escape . Thank heaven [she]108-pauline had a free hour ! [She]108-pauline threw [herself]108-pauline on [her]108-pauline lounge and turned [her]108-pauline gaze inward upon [herself]108-pauline : an exercise for which [she]108-pauline seldom had the leisure . Now that [she]108-pauline knew [she]108-pauline was safe , and had done nothing to discredit [herself]108-pauline or the cause , [she]108-pauline could penetrate an inch or two farther into the motive power of [her]108-pauline activities ; and what [she]108-pauline saw there frightened [her]108-pauline . To be [Chairman of [the Mothers]1045-the mothers ' Day Association]1081-chairman of the mothers ' day association , and [a speaker at the Birth Control banquet]1083-a speaker at the birth control banquet ! It did not need [[her]108-pauline daughter]917-her daughter 's derisive chuckle to give [her]917-her daughter the measure of [her]917-her daughter inconsequence . Yet to reconcile these contradictions had seemed as simple as to invite [the Chief Rabbi]452-the chief rabbi and [the Bishop of [New York]2-new york]450-the bishop of new york to meet [[Amalasuntha]117-amalasuntha 's Cardinal]1087-amalasuntha 's cardinal . Did not [the Mahatma]1088-the mahatma teach that , to the initiated , all discords were resolved into a higher harmony ? When [her]108-pauline hurried attention had been turned for a moment on the seeming inconsistency of encouraging natality and teaching how to restrict it , [she]108-pauline had felt it was sufficient answer to say that the two categories of [people]437-people appealed to were entirely different , and could not be " reached "[108-pauline] in the same way . In ethics , as in advertising , the main thing was to get at [[your]1090-your public]1091-your public . Hitherto this argument had satisfied [her]108-pauline . Feeling there was much to be said on both sides , [she]108-pauline had thrown [herself]108-pauline with equal zeal into the propagation of both doctrines ; but now , surveying [her]108-pauline attempt with a chastened eye , [she]108-pauline doubted its expediency . [He]1100-he had stamped up and down , watch in hand ... Well , [she]108-pauline supposed it was one of the symptoms of middle age : a passing phase . [She]108-pauline could afford to be generous , after twenty years of [his]1100-he devotion ; and [she]108-pauline meant to be . [Men]2738-men did n't grow old as gracefully as [women]1103-women -- [she]108-pauline knew enough not to nag [him]1100-he about [his]1100-he little flirtations , and was really rather grateful to that silly [Gladys Toy]163-gladys toy for making a fuss over [him]1100-he . [He]1100-he thrust the magazine under [his]1100-he arm , and threw it down , half an hour later , in [[Lita Wyant]105-lita 's boudoir]1120-lita wyant 's boudoir . It was so quiet and shadowy there that [he]1100-he was almost glad [Lita]105-lita was not in , though sometimes [her]105-lita unpunctuality annoyed [him]1100-he . This evening , after the rush and confusion of the day , [he]1100-he found it soothing to await [her]105-lita in [this half - lit room]1121-this half - lit room , with [its]1121-this half - lit room heaped - up cushions still showing where [she]105-lita had leaned , and the veiled light on two arums in a dark bowl . Wherever [Lita]105-lita was , there were some of [those smooth sculptural arums]1122-those smooth sculptural arums . When [she]105-lita came , the stillness would hardly be disturbed . [She]105-lita had a way of deepening it by [her]105-lita presence : noise and hurry died on [her]105-lita threshold . And this evening all [the house]530-the house was quiet . [Manford]108-pauline , as usual , had tiptoed up to take a look at [the baby]378-the baby , in [the night nursery]1125-the night nursery where there were such cool silver - coloured walls , and white hyacinths in pots of silvery lustre . [The baby]378-the baby slept , a round pink Hercules with defiant rosy curls , [his]378-the baby pink hands clenched on the coverlet . Even [the nurse by the lamp]1127-the nurse by the lamp sat quiet and silver - coloured as a brooding pigeon . [A house without fixed hours]1128-a house without fixed hours , engagements , [obligations ... where none of the clocks went]1129-obligations ... where none of the clocks went , and [nobody]2926-nobody was late , because there was no particular time for anything to happen . Absurd , of course , maddeningly unpractical -- but how restful after a crowded day ! And what a miracle to have achieved , in the tight pattern of [New York]2-new york 's tasks and pleasures -- in [the very place which seemed doomed to collapse and vanish if ever [its]1131-the very place which seemed doomed to collapse and vanish if ever its clocks should stop clocks should stop]1131-the very place which seemed doomed to collapse and vanish if ever its clocks should stop ! These late visits had begun by [Manford]108-pauline 's dropping in on the way [home]2630-home for a look at [the baby]378-the baby . [He]378-the baby liked [babies]407-babies in [their]407-babies cribs , and especially [this fat rascal of [Jim]116-jim 's]1135-this fat rascal of jim 's . Next to [Nona]102-nona , there was [no one]425-no one [he]378-the baby cared for as much as [Jim]116-jim ; and seeing [Jim]116-jim happily married , doing well at [[his]116-jim bank]1137-his bank , and with [that funny little chap]1138-that funny little chap [upstairs]443-upstairs , stirred in [the older man]1140-the older man all [his]1140-the older man old regrets that [he]1140-the older man had [no son]1141-no son . [Jim]116-jim seldom got back early enough to assist at these visits ; and [Lita]105-lita too , at first , was generally out . But in the last few months [Manford]102-nona had more often found [her]105-lita -- or at least , having fallen into the habit of lingering over a cigarette in [her]105-lita boudoir , had managed to get a glimpse of [her]105-lita before going on to [that other house]1142-that other house where all the clocks struck simultaneously , and the week 's engagements , in [Maisie Bruss]104-maisie 's hand , jumped out at [him]116-jim as [he]116-jim entered [[his]116-jim study]1143-his study . This evening [he]116-jim felt more than usually tired -- of [his]116-jim day , [his]116-jim work , [his]116-jim life , [himself]116-jim -- oh , especially [himself]116-jim ; so tired that , the deep armchair aiding , [he]116-jim slipped into a half - doze in which the quietness crept up round [him]116-jim like a tide . [He]116-jim woke with a start , imagining that [Lita]105-lita had entered , and feeling [the elderly man]1144-the elderly man 's discomfiture when beauty finds [him]116-jim napping ... But [the room]317-the room was empty : a movement of [his]116-jim own had merely knocked [Miss Vollard]147-miss vollard 's magazine to the floor . [He]116-jim remembered having brought it in to show [Lita]105-lita the photographs of [Cedarledge]5-cedarledge which [he]116-jim supposed it to contain . Would there be time ? [He]116-jim consulted [his]116-jim watch -- an anachronism in [that house]1146-that house -- lit another cigarette , and leaned back contentedly . [He]116-jim knew that as soon as [he]116-jim got [home]2630-home [Pauline]108-pauline , who had telephoned again that afternoon about [the Mahatma]123-the mahatma , would contrive to corner [him]116-jim and reopen the tiresome question , together with another , which threatened to be almost equally tiresome , about paying that rotten [Michelangelo]182-michelangelo 's debts . " If [we]3031-we do n't , [we]3031-we shall have [him]182-michelangelo here on [our]3031-we hands : [Amalasuntha]117-amalasuntha is convinced [you]116-jim 'll take [him]182-michelangelo into [the firm]1112-the firm . [You]116-jim 'd better come [home]2630-home in time to talk things over-- . "[108-pauline] Always talking over , interfering , adjusting ! [He]116-jim had enough of that in [his]116-jim profession . Pity [Pauline]108-pauline was n't [a lawyer]1148-a lawyer : [she]108-pauline might have worked off [her]108-pauline steam in office hours . [They]1150-they were dining out , [he]116-jim could n't remember where . Queer creature , [Lita]105-lita ! [His]116-jim lips twitched into a reminiscent smile . [Luckily Lita]194-lita]1156-that red - headed boy ... luckily lita liked [Nona]102-nona , and [the two]394-the two were a good deal together . [Nona]102-nona was as safe as a bank -- and as jolly as a cricket . Everything was sure to be right when [she]102-nona was [there]2641-there . But there were all the other hours , intervals that [Manford]102-nona had no way of accounting for ; and [Pauline]108-pauline always said [the girl]299-the girl had had a queer bringing - up , as indeed [any girl]1160-any girl must have had at the hands of [Mrs. Percy Landish]128-mrs. landish . [Pauline]108-pauline had objected to the marriage on that ground , though [the modern mother]2941-the modern mother 's respect for the independence of [[her]2941-the modern mother children]286-her children had reduced [her]2941-the modern mother objection to mere shadowy hints of which [Jim]116-jim , in [his]116-jim transports , took no heed . [Manford]102-nona also disliked [the girl]299-the girl at first , and deplored [Jim]116-jim 's choice . [He]116-jim thought [Lita]194-lita positively ugly , with [her]194-lita high cheekbones , [her]194-lita too small head , [her]194-lita glaring clothes and conceited lackadaisical airs . Then , as time passed , and the marriage appeared after all to be turning out well , [he]116-jim tried to interest [himself]116-jim in [her]194-lita for [Jim]116-jim 's sake , to see in [her]194-lita what [Jim]116-jim apparently did . But [she]194-lita never bored [him]116-jim , never ceased to excite in [him]116-jim a sort of irritated interest . [He]116-jim told [himself]116-jim that it was because [one]325-one could never be sure what [she]194-lita was up to ; speculating on what went on behind that smooth round forehead and those elusive eyes became [his]116-jim most absorbing occupation . Lately [she]194-lita had seemed restless , vaguely impatient with things ; and [Manford]102-nona was determined to win [her]194-lita confidence and get at the riddle behind that smooth round brow . [He]116-jim could not bear the idea that [Jim]116-jim 's marriage might turn out to be a mere unsuccessful adventure , like so many others . [Lita]194-lita must be made to understand what a treasure [she]194-lita possessed , and how easily [she]194-lita might lose it . [Lita Cliffe]105-lita -- [[Mrs. Percy Landish]128-mrs. landish 's niece]1168-mrs. percy landish 's niece -- to have had the luck to marry [Jim Wyant]110-jim , and to risk estranging [him]116-jim ! Well , only a few weeks more , and perhaps it would come true . [She]105-lita had never seen the Cedarledge dogwood in bud , [the woods]1183-the woods trembling into green . " Dawnside Co - Eds"--oh[123-the mahatma] , damn ... [He]556-her husband stood up to thrust the paper under one of the heavily - shaded lamps . At [home]2630-home , where [Pauline]108-pauline and reason ruled , the lighting was disposed in such a way that [one]325-one could always read without moving from one 's chair ; but in [this ridiculous house]1189-this ridiculous house , where [no one]425-no one ever opened a book , the lamps were so perversely placed , and so deeply shrouded , that one had to hold one 's paper under the shade to make out anything . [He]556-her husband scrutinized the picture , shrugged away [his]556-her husband disgusted recognition of [Bee Lindon]140-bee , looked again and straightened [his]556-her husband eye - glasses on [his]556-her husband nose to be doubly sure -- [the lawyer]2964-the lawyer 's instinct of accuracy prevailing over a furious inward tremor . [Pauline]108-pauline had been right : what could [one]325-one expect from [a girl brought up in [that Landish house]1198-that landish house]1197-a girl brought up in that landish house ? "[105-lita] [she]105-lita yawned . _ BOOK II _ XI [PAULINE MANFORD]108-pauline was losing faith in [herself]108-pauline ; [she]108-pauline felt the need of a new moral tonic . Could [she]108-pauline still obtain it from the old sources ? The morning after [the Toys]197-the toys ' dinner , considering the advisability of repairing to [that small bare room]1210-that small bare room at Dawnside where [the Mahatma]123-the mahatma gave [[his]1209-he private audiences]1211-his private audiences , [she]108-pauline felt a chill of doubt . [She]108-pauline would have preferred , just then , not to be confronted with [the sage]1212-the sage ; in going to [him]1212-the sage [she]108-pauline risked [[her]108-pauline husband]556-her husband 's anger , and prudence warned [her]108-pauline to keep out of the coming struggle . If [the Mahatma]123-the mahatma should ask [her]108-pauline to intervene [she]108-pauline could only answer that [she]108-pauline had already done so unsuccessfully ; and such admissions , while generally useless , are always painful . Yet guidance [she]108-pauline must have : [no Papist in quest of " direction "]3042-no papist in quest of " direction "[108-pauline] ( was n't that what [Amalasuntha]117-amalasuntha called it ? ) could have felt the need more acutely . Certainly the sacrament of confession , from which [Pauline]108-pauline 's ingrained Protestantism recoiled in horror , must have its uses at such moments . But to whom , if not to [the Mahatma]123-the mahatma , could [she]108-pauline confess ? [Dexter]103-dexter had gone down [town]2627-town without asking to see [her]108-pauline ; [she]108-pauline had been sure [he]556-her husband would , after [their]1215-their drive to and from [the Toys ']197-the toys the evening before . When [he]556-her husband was in one of [his]556-her husband moods of clenched silence -- they were becoming more frequent , [she]108-pauline had remarked -- [she]108-pauline knew the uselessness of interfering . Echoes of the Freudian doctrine , perhaps rather confusedly apprehended , had strengthened [her]108-pauline faith in the salutariness of " talking things over , "[108-pauline] and [she]108-pauline longed to urge this remedy again on [Dexter]103-dexter ; but the last time [she]108-pauline had done so [he]556-her husband had wounded [her]108-pauline by replying that [he]556-her husband preferred [an aperient]1216-an aperient . And in [his]556-her husband present mood of stony inaccessibility [he]556-her husband might say something even coarser . [She]108-pauline sat in [[her]108-pauline boudoir]1217-her boudoir , painfully oppressed by an hour of unexpected leisure . [The facial - massage artist]1218-the facial - massage artist had the grippe , and had notified [her]108-pauline only at the last moment . To be sure , [she]108-pauline had skipped [her]108-pauline " Silent Meditation "[108-pauline] that morning ; but [she]108-pauline did not feel in the mood for it now . And besides , an hour is too long for meditation -- an hour is too long for anything . Now that [she]108-pauline had one to [herself]108-pauline , for the first time in years , [she]108-pauline did n't in the least know what to do with it . That was something which [no one]425-no one had ever thought of teaching [her]108-pauline ; and the sense of being surrounded by a sudden void , into which [she]108-pauline could reach out on all sides without touching an engagement or an obligation , produced in [her]108-pauline a sort of mental dizziness . [She]108-pauline had taken plenty of rest - cures , of course ; [[all one]1220-all one 's friends]1221-all one 's friends did . But during a rest - cure one was always busy resting ; every minute was crammed with passive activities ; [one]325-one never had this queer sense of inoccupation , never had to face an absolutely featureless expanse of time . It made [her]108-pauline feel as if [the world]303-the world had rushed by and forgotten [her]108-pauline . An hour -- why , there was no way of measuring the length of an empty hour ! It stretched away into infinity like the endless road in a nightmare ; it gaped before [her]108-pauline like the slippery sides of an abyss . Nervously [she]108-pauline began to wonder what [she]108-pauline could do to fill it -- if there were not some new picture show or [dressmakers]1224-dressmakers ' opening or hygienic exhibition that [she]108-pauline might cram into it before the minute hand switched round to [her]108-pauline next engagement . [She]108-pauline took up [her]108-pauline list to see what that engagement was . " 11.45 . [Mrs. Swoffer]198-mrs. swoffer . "[108-pauline] Oh , to be sure ... [Mrs. Swoffer]198-mrs. swoffer . [Maisie]104-maisie had reminded [her]108-pauline that morning . The relief was instantaneous . Only , who _ was [_ Mrs. Swoffer]198-mrs. swoffer ? " [You]104-maisie speak for [so _ many _ of [us]3044-us]3043-so _ many _ of us , "[104-maisie] [she]104-maisie breathed , and recovered [Pauline]108-pauline 's hand for another pressure . But [she]104-maisie _ had _ come for [the children]1231-the children , all the same ; and that was really coming for [the mothers]1045-the mothers , was n't it ? Only [she]104-maisie wanted to reach [the mothers]1045-the mothers through [the children]1231-the children -- reversing the usual process . [Mrs. Swoffer]198-mrs. swoffer said [she]198-mrs. swoffer believed in reversing almost everything . Standing on [your]1235-your head was one of the most restorative physical exercises , and [she]198-mrs. swoffer believed it was the same mentally and morally . It was a good thing to stand [one]325-one 's _ soul _ upside down . And so [she]198-mrs. swoffer 'd come about [the children]1231-the children ... The point was to form a League -- [a huge International League of [Mothers]3019-mothers]1238-a huge international league of mothers -- against the dreadful old practice of telling [children]853-children [they]853-children were naughty . Had [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter ever stopped to think what an abominable thing it was to suggest to [a pure innocent child]1241-a pure innocent child that there was such a thing in [the world]303-the world as Being Naughty ? What did it open the door to ? Why , to the idea of Wickedness , the most awful idea in [the whole world]2618-the whole world . Of course [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter would see at once what getting rid of the idea of Wickedness would lead to . How could there be [bad men]1244-bad men if there were [no bad children]1245-no bad children ? And how could there be [bad children]1246-bad children if [children]853-children were never allowed to know that such a thing as badness existed ? There was [a splendid woman]1248-a splendid woman -- [Orba Clapp]199-orba clapp ; no doubt [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter had heard of [her?--who]1249-her?--who was getting up a gigantic world - wide movement to boycott [the manufacturers and sellers of all military toys]1250-the manufacturers and sellers of all military toys , [tin soldiers]1251-tin soldiers , cannon , toy rifles , water - pistols and so on . [Mrs. Percy Landish]128-mrs. landish 's hands were always full to overflowing with [her]128-mrs. landish own difficulties . A succession of ingenious theories of life , and the relentless pursuit of originality , had landed [her]128-mrs. landish in a state of chronic embarrassment , pecuniary , social and sentimental . The announcement that [Lita]105-lita was tired of [Jim]110-jim , and threatened to leave [him]110-jim , would fall like a bombshell on that precarious roof which figured in the [New York]2-new york Directory as somewhere in [the East Hundreds]56-the east hundreds , but was recorded in the " Social Register "[128-mrs. landish] as [No . 1 Viking Court]1303-no . 1 viking court . [Mrs. Landish]128-mrs. landish 's last fad had been to establish [herself]128-mrs. landish on [the banks of [the East River]39-the east river]1304-the banks of the east river , which [she]128-mrs. landish and [a group of [friends]1306-friends]1305-a group of friends had adorned with [a cluster of reinforced - cement bungalows]1307-a cluster of reinforced - cement bungalows , first christened [El Patio]57-el patio , but altered to [Viking Court]58-viking court after [Mrs. Landish]128-mrs. landish had read in an illustrated weekly that [the Vikings]1308-the vikings , who had discovered [America]47-america ages before [Columbus]59-columbus , had not , as previously supposed , effected [their]1308-the vikings first landing at [Vineyard Haven]60-vineyard haven , but at a spot not far from the site of [[her]128-mrs. landish dwelling]1309-her dwelling . Cement , at an early stage , is malleable , and the Alhambra _ motifs _ had hastily given way to others from [the prows of [Nordic ships]1311-nordic ships]1310-the prows of nordic ships , from silver torques and Runic inscriptions , the latter easily contrived out of Arabic _ sourats _ from [the Koran]61-the koran . Before these new ornaments were dry , [Mrs. Landish]128-mrs. landish and [[her]128-mrs. landish friends]2617-her friends were camping on [the historic spot]1313-the historic spot ; and after four years of occupancy [they]1314-they were camping still , in [Mrs. Manford]103-dexter 's sense of the word . A hurried telephone call had assured [Pauline]108-pauline that [she]108-pauline could see [Mrs. Landish]128-mrs. landish directly after lunch ; and at two o'clock [her]128-mrs. landish motor drove up to [Viking Court]58-viking court , which opened on [a dilapidated river - front and was cynically overlooked by [tall tenement houses with an underpinning of delicatessen stores]1316-tall tenement houses with an underpinning of delicatessen stores]1315-a dilapidated river - front and was cynically overlooked by tall tenement houses with an underpinning of delicatessen stores . [Mrs. Landish]128-mrs. landish was nowhere to be found . [She]128-mrs. landish had had to go out to lunch , [a melancholy maid - servant]1317-a melancholy maid - servant said , because [the cook]2729-the cook had just given notice ; but [she]128-mrs. landish would doubtless soon be back . With gingerly steps [Pauline]108-pauline entered [the " living - room]3114-the " living - room , "[128-mrs. landish] so called ( as [visitors]1319-visitors were unfailingly reminded ) because [Mrs. Landish]128-mrs. landish ate , painted , modelled in clay , sculptured in wood , and received [[her]128-mrs. landish friends]2617-her friends [there]2641-there . [The Vikings]1308-the vikings , [she]128-mrs. landish added , had lived in that way . But today all traces of these varied activities had disappeared , and [the room]317-the room was austerely empty . [Mrs. Landish]128-mrs. landish 's last hobby was for what [she]128-mrs. landish called " purism , "[128-mrs. landish] and [her]128-mrs. landish chief desire to make everything in [her]128-mrs. landish surroundings conform to the habits and industries of a mythical past . Ever since [she]128-mrs. landish had created [Viking Court]1324-viking court [she]128-mrs. landish had been trying to obtain rushes for the floor : but as [the Eastern States of America]1325-the eastern states of america did not produce the particular variety of rush which [the Vikings]1308-the vikings were said to have used [she]128-mrs. landish had at last decided to have rugs woven on handlooms in [Abyssinia]62-abyssinia , [some one]1280-some one having assured [her]128-mrs. landish that an inscription referring to trade - relations between [the Vikings]210-the vikings and [the kingdom of [Prester John]211-prester john]1328-the kingdom of prester john had been discovered in [the ruins of [Petra]63-petra]1329-the ruins of petra . The difficulty of having these rugs made according to designs of the period caused the cement floor of [[Mrs. Landish]128-mrs. landish 's living - room]1330-mrs. landish 's living - room to remain permanently bare , and most of the furniture having now been removed , [the room]317-the room had all the appearance of [a garage]1332-a garage , the more so as [Mrs. Landish]128-mrs. landish 's latest protégé , [a young cabaret - artist who performed on [a motor - siren]1334-a motor - siren]1333-a young cabaret - artist who performed on a motor - siren , had been suffered to stable [his]1333-a young cabaret - artist who performed on a motor - siren cycle in one corner . "[1353-he] [Pauline]108-pauline caught the change in [his]1353-he tone . "[1353-he] It was just the sort of thing [she]108-pauline wanted [him]1353-he to say , but not in the voice in which [he]1353-he said it . The voice was full of hesitation and embarrassment . " It was too screamingly funny , "[108-pauline] [she]108-pauline flung at [them]1371-them out of the vortex . [She]103-dexter has a vital message for [all Mothers]3145-all mothers . "[110-jim] [Wyant]110-jim leaned back and laughed . [His]110-jim laugh was a contagious chuckle , easily provoked and spreading in circles like a full spring . [Jim]110-jim gave a large shout at [his]110-jim own mimicry , and [Heuston]137-heuston joined the chorus on a dry note that neither spread nor echoed , but seemed suddenly to set bounds to [their]1375-their mirth . [Nona]102-nona felt a momentary resentment of [his]110-jim tone . Was [he]110-jim implying that [they]1375-their were ridiculing [[their]1375-their mother]864-their mother ? [They]1375-their were n't , [they]1375-their were only admiring [her]864-their mother in [their]1375-their own way , which had always been humorous and half - parental . [Stan]137-heuston ought to have understood by this time -- and have guessed why [Nona]102-nona , at this moment , caught at any pretext to make [Jim]110-jim laugh , to make everything in [their]1375-their joint lives appear to [him]110-jim normal and jolly . But [Stanley]137-heuston always seemed to see beyond a joke , even when [he]137-heuston was in the very middle of it . [He]137-heuston was like that about everything in life ; forever walking around things , weighing and measuring them , and making [his]137-heuston disenchanted calculations . In [the street]2702-the street [she]102-nona found [herself]102-nona walking silently at [[Heuston]137-heuston 's side]1387-heuston 's side . These weekly meetings with [him]137-heuston at [Wyant 's]105-lita were becoming a tacit arrangement : the one thing in [her]102-nona life that gave it meaning . [She]102-nona thought with a smile of [[her]102-nona mother]276-her mother 's affirmation that everything always came out right if only [one]325-one kept on being brave and trustful , and wondered where , under that formula , [her]102-nona relation to [Stanley Heuston]137-heuston could be fitted in . It was anything but brave -- letting [herself]102-nona drift into these continual meetings , and refusing to accept their consequences . Yet every nerve in [her]102-nona told [her]102-nona that these moments were the best thing in life , the one thing [she]102-nona could n't do without : just to be near [him]110-jim , to hear [his]110-jim cold voice , to say something to provoke [his]110-jim disenchanted laugh ; or , better still , to walk by [him]110-jim as now without talking , with a furtive glance now and then at [his]110-jim profile , ironic , dissatisfied , defiant -- yes , and so weak under the defiance ... The fact that [she]102-nona judged and still loved showed that [her]102-nona malady was mortal . " Oh , well -- it wo n't last ; nothing lasts for [our]3180-our lot , "[102-nona] [she]102-nona murmured to [herself]102-nona without conviction . " Or at the worst it will only last as long as [I]102-nona do ; and that 's a date [I]102-nona can fix as [I]102-nona choose . "[102-nona] What nonsense , though , to talk like that , when [all those others]1390-all those others needed [her]102-nona : [Jim]110-jim and [his]110-jim silly [Lita]105-lita , [[her]102-nona father]369-her father , yes , even [[her]102-nona proud self - confident father]1392-her proud self - confident father , and [poor old Exhibit A and [[her]102-nona mother]276-her mother who was so sure that nothing would ever go wrong again , now [she]102-nona had found [a new Healer]1395-a new healer]1393-poor old exhibit a and her mother who was so sure that nothing would ever go wrong again , now she had found a new healer ! " Look here , [Nona]102-nona : [my]102-nona dinner - engagement was a fable . "[102-nona] " Oh , [Stan--]215-stan-- "[102-nona] [Her]102-nona heart gave a leap of joy . In these free days , when [the young]648-the young came and went as [they]648-the young chose , who would have believed that [these two]1400-these two had never yet given [themselves]1400-these two a stolen evening ? Perhaps it was just because it was so easy . Only difficult things tempted [Nona]102-nona , and the difficult thing was always to say " No . "[137-heuston] Yet was it ? [She]102-nona stole a glance at [Heuston]137-heuston 's profile , as a street - lamp touched it , saw the set lips already preparing a taunt at [her]102-nona refusal , and wondered if saying no to everything required as much courage as [she]102-nona liked to think . What if moral cowardice were the core of [her]102-nona boasted superiority ? [She]102-nona did n't want to be " like [the others"--but]3181-the others"--but[102-nona] was there anything to be proud of in that ? Perhaps [her]102-nona disinterestedness was only a subtler vanity , not unrelated , say , to [Lita]105-lita 's refusal to let [a friend]1401-a friend copy [her]105-lita new dresses , or [Bee Lindon]140-bee 's perpetual craving to scandalize a world sated with scandals . [Exhibitionists]1402-exhibitionists , one and all of [them]1402-exhibitionists , as [the psycho - analysts]1403-the psycho - analysts said -- and , in [her]102-nona present mood , moral exhibitionism seemed to [her]102-nona the meanest form of the display . " How mid - Victorian , [Stan]137-heuston ! "[102-nona] [she]102-nona laughed . " As if there were any heavens to fall ! Where shall [we]3182-we go ? It will be the greatest fun . Is n't there rather [a good little Italian restaurant]3183-a good little italian restaurant somewhere near here ? And afterward there 's [that nigger]3184-that nigger dancing at [the Housetop]3185-the housetop . "[102-nona] " Come along , then ! "[102-nona] [She]102-nona felt as little and light as a wisp of straw carried out into the rushing darkness of [a sea]1404-a sea splashed with millions of stars . Just the thought of a friendly evening , an evening of simple comradeship , could do that ; could give [her]102-nona back [her]102-nona youth , yes , and the courage to persevere . [She]102-nona put [her]102-nona hand through [his]1405-his arm , and knew by [his]1405-his silence that [he]1405-his was thinking [her]102-nona thoughts . That was the final touch of magic . " [You]102-nona really want to go to [the Housetop]3185-the housetop ? "[1405-his] [he]1405-his questioned , leaning back to light [his]1405-his cigar with a leisurely air , as if there need never again be any hurrying about anything . [Their]1406-their dinner at [the little Italian restaurant]1407-the little italian restaurant was nearly over . [They]1406-their had conscientiously explored the _ paste _ , the _ frutte di mare _ , the _ fritture _ and the cheese - and - tomato mixtures , and were ending up with a foaming _ sabaione _ . [The room]317-the room was low - ceilinged , hot , and crowded with [jolly noisy people]1409-jolly noisy people , mostly Italians , over whom , at unnoticed intervals , [an olive - tinted musician with blue - white eyeballs showered trills and twangings]1410-an olive - tinted musician with blue - white eyeballs showered trills and twangings . [His]1405-his music did not interrupt the conversation , but merely obliged [the diners]1411-the diners to shout a little louder ; a pretext of which [they]1411-the diners joyfully availed [themselves]1411-the diners . [Nona]102-nona , at first , had found the noise a delicious shelter for [her]102-nona talk with [Heuston]137-heuston ; but now it was beginning to stifle [her]102-nona . " Let 's get some fresh air first , "[102-nona] [she]102-nona said . " All right . [We]1406-their 'll walk for a while . "[102-nona] [They]1406-their pushed back [their]1406-their chairs , wormed a way through the packed tables , got into [their]1406-their wraps , and stepped out of the swinging doors into long streamers of watery lamplight . The douche of a cold rain received [them]1406-their . " Oh , dear -- [the Housetop]3185-the housetop , then ! "[102-nona] [Nona]102-nona grumbled . How sweet the rain would have been under the budding trees of [Cedarledge]5-cedarledge ! But here , in [these degraded streets]1412-these degraded streets ... [Heuston]137-heuston caught [a passing taxi]1413-a passing taxi . " A turn , first -- just round [the Park]3188-the park ? "[137-heuston] " No ; [the Housetop]3185-the housetop . "[137-heuston] [He]137-heuston leaned back and lit a cigarette . "[137-heuston] " No : not yet . But with [the lady [I]102-nona 'm going off with]3190-the lady i 'm going off with . [My]102-nona word of honour . [I]102-nona am ; next week . "[102-nona] [Nona]102-nona gave an incredulous laugh . " So this is good - bye ? "[102-nona] " Very nearly . "[137-heuston] " [Poor Stan]216-stan ! "[137-heuston] " This ? This -- what ? "[102-nona] [She]102-nona struggled out of another enfolding , put [her]102-nona head out of the window , and cried : " [The Housetop]3185-the housetop ! "[102-nona] [They]1414-their found a corner at the back of [the crowded floor]1415-the crowded floor . [Nona]102-nona blinked a little in the dazzle of light - garlands , the fumes of smoke , the clash of noise and colours . But there [he]137-heuston and [she]102-nona sat , close together , hidden in [their]1414-their irresistible happiness , and though [his]137-heuston lips had their moody twist [she]102-nona knew the same softness was in [his]137-heuston veins as in [hers]102-nona , isolating [them]1414-their from [the crowd]1416-the crowd as completely as if [they]1414-their had still been in the darkness of [the taxi]673-the taxi . That was the way [she]102-nona must take [her]102-nona life , [she]102-nona supposed ; piece - meal , a tiny scrap of sweetness at a time , and never more than a scrap -- never once ! Well -- it would be worse still if there were no moments like this , short and cruel as they seemed when they came . [The Housetop]3185-the housetop was packed . [The low balcony]1419-the low balcony crammed with [fashionable people]1420-fashionable people overhung [them]1419-the low balcony like a wreath of ripe fruits , peachy and white and golden , made of painted faces , bare arms , jewels , brocades and fantastic furs . It was the music - hall of the moment . The curtain shot up , and [the little auditorium]1421-the little auditorium was plunged in shadow . [Nona]102-nona could leave [her]102-nona hand in [Heuston]143-aggie 's . On [the stage]1422-the stage -- [a New [Orleans]70-orleans cotton - market]1423-a new orleans cotton - market -- [black dancers]1424-black dancers tossed and capered . [They]1424-black dancers were like ripe fruits too , black figs flung about in hot sunshine , falling to earth with crimson bursts of laughter splitting open on white teeth , and bounding up again into golden clouds of cotton - dust . It was all warm and jolly and inconsequent . [The audience]991-the audience forgot to smoke and chatter : little murmurs of enjoyment rippled over it . The curtain descended , the light - garlands blossomed out , and once more [floor]1426-floor and [balcony]1427-balcony were all sound and movement . "[102-nona] and plunged away into the rain . [XIV PAULINE MANFORD]108-pauline left [Mrs. Landish]128-mrs. landish 's door with the uncomfortable sense of having swallowed a new frustration . In this crowded life of [hers]108-pauline they were as difficult to avoid as germs -- and there was not always time to have them extirpated ! [Manford]108-pauline had evidently found out about [Lita]105-lita 's Dawnside frequentations ; found it out , no doubt , as [Pauline]108-pauline had , by seeing [her]108-pauline photograph in [that loathsome dancing group in the " Looker - on]3215-that loathsome dancing group in the " looker - on . "[108-pauline] Well , perhaps it was best that [he]1436-he should know ; it would certainly confirm [his]1436-he resolve to stop any action against [the Mahatma]123-the mahatma . Only -- if [he]1436-he had induced [the Lindons]139-the lindons to drop the investigation , why was [he]1436-he still preoccupied by it ? Why had [he]1436-he gone to [Mrs. Landish]128-mrs. landish to make that particular inquiry about [Lita]105-lita ? [Pauline]108-pauline would have liked to shake off the memory of [his]1436-he voice , and of the barely disguised impatience with which [he]1436-he had waited for [her]108-pauline to go before putting [his]1436-he question . Confronted by this new riddle ( when there were already so many others in [her]108-pauline path ) [she]108-pauline felt a reasonless exasperation against the broken doorknob which had let [her]108-pauline into the secret . If only [Kitty Landish]129-kitty , instead of dreaming about [Mesopotamian embroideries]1445-mesopotamian embroideries , would send for [a locksmith]1446-a locksmith and keep [[her]129-kitty house]449-her house in repair ! All day [Pauline]108-pauline was oppressed by the nervous apprehension that [Manford]108-pauline might have changed [his]1436-he mind about dropping the investigation . If there had been time [she]108-pauline would have gone to [Alvah Loft]202-alvah loft for relief ; [she]108-pauline had managed so far to squeeze in a daily _ séance _ , and had come to depend on it as " [addicts "]3216-addicts "[108-pauline] do on [their]1448-their morphia . The very brevity of the treatment , and the blunt negative face and indifferent monosyllables of [the Healer]1449-the healer , were subtly stimulating after the verbiage and flummery of [his]1436-he predecessors . Such stern economy of means impressed [Pauline]108-pauline in much the same way as a new labour - saving device ; [she]108-pauline liked everything the better for being a short - cut to something else , and even spiritual communion for resembling an improved form of stenography . As [Mrs. Swoffer]198-mrs. swoffer said , [Alvah Loft]202-alvah loft was really [[the Busy Man]1450-the busy man 's Christ]1451-the busy man 's christ . But that afternoon there was literally not time for a treatment . [Manford]108-pauline 's decision to spend the Easter holidays at [Cedarledge]5-cedarledge necessitated one of those campaigns of intensive preparation in which [[his]1436-he wife]389-his wife and [Maisie Bruss]104-maisie excelled . Leading the simple life at [Cedarledge]5-cedarledge involved despatching there [a part of [the New York domestic staff]1454-the new york domestic staff]1453-a part of the new york domestic staff at least ten days in advance , testing and lighting three complicated heating systems , going over all the bells and electric wiring , and making sure that the elaborate sanitary arrangements were in irreproachable order . Nor was this all . [Pauline]108-pauline , who prided [herself]108-pauline on the perfect organization of every detail of both [[her]108-pauline establishments]1455-her establishments , had lately been studying the estimate for a new and singularly complete system of burglar - alarm at [Cedarledge]5-cedarledge , and also going over the bills for [the picturesque engine - house]1456-the picturesque engine - house and up - to - date fire - engine with which [she]108-pauline had just endowed [[the village]1457-the village patriarchally clustered below [the Cedarledge hill]1459-the cedarledge hill]1458-the village patriarchally clustered below the cedarledge hill . All these matters called for deep thought and swift decision ; and the fact gave [her]108-pauline a sudden stimulus . No rest - cure in [the world]303-the world was as refreshing to [her]108-pauline as a hurried demand on [her]108-pauline practical activity ; [she]108-pauline thrilled to it like a war - horse to a trumpet , and compelled the fagged [Maisie]104-maisie to thrill in unison . In this case [their]1461-their energy was redoubled by the hope that , if [Manford]108-pauline found everything to [his]1462-his liking at [Cedarledge]5-cedarledge , [he]1462-his might take a fancy to spending more time [there]2641-there . [Pauline]108-pauline 's passionate interest in plumbing and electric wiring was suffused with a romantic glow at the thought that [they]1461-their might lure [[her]108-pauline husband]556-her husband back to domestic intimacy . " The heating of [the new swimming - pool]3217-the new swimming - pool must be finished too , and [the workmen]3218-the workmen all out of the way -- [you'll]3219-you'll have to go [there]2641-there next week , [Maisie]104-maisie , and impress on [everybody]2612-everybody that there must not be [a workman visible anywhere]3222-a workman visible anywhere when [we]3223-we arrive . "[108-pauline] Breathless , exultant , [Pauline]108-pauline hurried [home]2630-home for a late cup of tea in [her]108-pauline boudoir , and settled down , pencil in hand , with plans and estimates , as eagerly as [[her]108-pauline husband]556-her husband , in the early days of [his]556-her husband legal career , used to study the documents of a new case . [Maisie]104-maisie , responding as [she]104-maisie always did to the least touch of the spur , yet lifted a perplexed brow to murmur : " All right . But [I]104-maisie do n't see how [I]104-maisie can very well leave before the Birth Control dinner . [You]108-pauline know [you]108-pauline have n't yet rewritten the opening passage that [you]108-pauline used by mistake at the-- "[104-maisie] [Pauline]108-pauline 's colour rose . [Maisie]104-maisie 's way of putting it was tactless ; but the fact remained that the opening of that unlucky speech had to be rewritten , and that [Pauline]108-pauline was never very sure of [her]108-pauline syntax unless [Maisie]104-maisie 's reinforced it . [She]108-pauline had always meant to be cultivated -- [she]108-pauline still thought [she]108-pauline was when [she]108-pauline looked at [her]108-pauline bookshelves . But when [she]108-pauline had to compose a speech , though words never failed [her]108-pauline , the mysterious relations between [them]1467-them sometimes did . Wealth and extensive social activities were obviously incompatible with a complete mastery of grammar , and [secretaries]1468-secretaries were made for such emergencies . Yes ; [Maisie]104-maisie , fagged as [she]104-maisie looked , could certainly not be spared till the speech was remodelled . The telephone , ringing from [downstairs]596-downstairs , announced that [the Marchesa]2723-the marchesa was on [her]2723-the marchesa way up to [the boudoir]1471-the boudoir . [Pauline]108-pauline 's pencil fell from [her]108-pauline hand . On [her]2723-the marchesa way up ! It was really too inconsiderate ... [Amalasuntha]117-amalasuntha must be made to understand ... But there was [the undaunted lady]1472-the undaunted lady . " [The footman]3224-the footman swore [you]1472-the undaunted lady were out , [dear]2609-dear ; but [I]1472-the undaunted lady knew from [his]3224-the footman manner that [I]1472-the undaunted lady should find [you]1472-the undaunted lady . ( With Powder , now , [I]1472-the undaunted lady never can tell . ) And [I]1472-the undaunted lady simply _ had _ to rush in long enough to give [you]1472-the undaunted lady a good hug . "[1472-the undaunted lady] [The Marchesa]114-the marchesa glanced at [Maisie]104-maisie , and [the secretary]281-the secretary effaced [herself]281-the secretary after another glance , this time from [[her]281-the secretary employer]1474-her employer , which plainly warned [her]281-the secretary : " Wait in [the next room]3226-the next room ; [I]281-the secretary wo n't let [her]1475-her visitor stay . "[281-the secretary] To [[her]281-the secretary visitor]1475-her visitor [Pauline]108-pauline murmured somewhat coldly : " [I]108-pauline left word that [I]108-pauline was out because [I]108-pauline 'm desperately busy over the new plumbing and burglar - alarm systems at [Cedarledge]5-cedarledge . [Dexter]103-dexter wants to go [there]2641-there for Easter , and of course everything must be in order before [we]3228-we arrive ... "[108-pauline] [The Marchesa]114-the marchesa 's eyes widened . " Ah , [this marvellous American plumbing]3229-this marvellous american plumbing ! [XV MANFORD]224-xv manford , the day after [[his]1493-he daughter]341-his daughter had caught sight of [him]1493-he at [the Housetop]3185-the housetop , started out early for one of [his]1493-he long tramps around [the Park]3188-the park . [He]1493-he was not due at [[his]1493-he office]2628-his office till ten , and [he]1493-he wanted first to walk [himself]1493-he tired . [He]1493-he took to [his]1493-he feet to make it last longer , and when there was no time to walk had in a _ masseur _ who prepared [him]1493-he , in the same way as [everybody else]2800-everybody else , for the long hours of sedentary hurry known as " business . "[1506-they] The [New York]2-new york routine had closed in on [him]1493-he , and [he]1493-he sometimes felt that , for intrinsic interest , there was little to choose between [Pauline]108-pauline 's hurry and [his]1493-he own . [They]1506-they seemed , all of [them]1506-they -- [lawyers]1011-lawyers , [bankers]1508-bankers , [brokers]1509-brokers , [railway - directors]1510-railway - directors and [the rest]1511-the rest -- to be cheating [their]1506-they inner emptiness with activities as futile as those of [the women [they]1506-they went [home]2630-home to]1512-the women they went home to . It was all wrong -- something about it was fundamentally wrong . [They]1506-they all had these colossal plans for acquiring power , and then , when it was acquired , what came of it but [bigger houses]1514-bigger houses , more food , more motors , more pearls , and a more self - righteous philanthropy ? The philanthropy was what [he]1493-he most hated : all these expensive plans for moral forcible feeding , for compelling [everybody]2612-everybody to be cleaner , stronger , healthier and happier than [they]2612-everybody would have been by the unaided light of Nature . The longing to get away into a world where [men]2738-men and [women sinned and begot]1517-women sinned and begot , lived and died , as [they]1506-they chose , without the perpetual intervention of [optimistic millionaires]1518-optimistic millionaires , had become so strong that [he]1493-he sometimes felt the chain of habit would snap with [his]1493-he first jerk . [She]2874-jim 's wife was [the one person in [[his]1493-he group to whom its catchwords meant absolutely nothing]1521-his group to whom its catchwords meant absolutely nothing]1520-the one person in his group to whom its catchwords meant absolutely nothing . "[2874-jim 's wife] [One]325-one could never fix [her]325-one attention on any subject beyond [her]325-one own immediate satisfaction , and that animal sincerity seemed to [Manford]108-pauline [her]325-one greatest charm . Now a passionate pity had replaced [his]1527-he fatuous emotion , [the baleful siren]1530-the baleful siren was only [a misguided child]1531-a misguided child , and [he]1527-he was to help and save [her]2874-jim 's wife for [Jim]110-jim 's sake and [her]2874-jim 's wife own . [He]1527-he must go on seeing [her]2874-jim 's wife , of course ; there was more reason than ever for seeing [her]2874-jim 's wife ; but there would be no danger in it now , only help for [her]2874-jim 's wife -- and perhaps healing for [him]1527-he .
